Create and implement new programming to expand donor base, keep current donors and re-engage past donors. Supervise Assistant Director of External Relations, Assistant Director of Alumni Programming and Assistant. Support dean in recruiting, staffing and managing International Advisory Board. Assist in the creation and implementation of strategic planning for outreach and marketing of the school and its various research centers including international outreach, media campaigns and large public events. Responsible for planning and executing over 40 constituent events each year. Collaborate with UC San Diego Foundation to ensure proper stewardship and management of endowments. Interact regularly with UC San Diego Office of Planned Giving, Corporate and Foundation Relations and legal counsel to draft, solicit and steward complex gift agreements.
metadata: 负责筹集超过200万美元的年度支持资金，并始终超过目标至少30%。识别、培养、招揽和管理25000美元及以上的主要礼物。与院长和中央发展部合作，确定学校的筹资重点。为每年吸引超过10万美元新捐款的基金会、公司和私人捐助者创建创新的筹资模式。创建和实施新的方案，以扩大捐助者基础，留住现有捐助者，并与过去的捐助者重新接触。监督外部关系助理总监、校友计划助理总监和助理。支持院长招聘、配置和管理国际咨询委员会。协助制定和实施学校及其各研究中心的外联和营销战略规划，包括国际外联、媒体宣传和大型公共活动。负责规划和执行每年超过40项的活动。与加州大学圣地亚哥分校基金会合作，确保妥善管理捐赠基金。定期与加州大学圣地亚哥分校计划捐赠办公室、公司和基金会关系办公室以及法律顾问互动，起草、征求和管理复杂的礼品协议。

text: Cultivate, solicit and steward major and special parent prospects and donations for all approved USD fundraising priorities. Coordinate fundraising efforts in collaboration with Central Development, faculty, academic administrators, senior executives and trustees of the university. Manage parent and new student gatherings throughout the U.S. Recruited, staffed and managed national Parent Association Board and collaborate with Parents Association presidents to implement fundraising strategies.
metadata: 培养、招揽和管理主要和特殊家长潜在客户，并为所有批准的美元筹款优先事项捐款。与中央发展、教员、学术管理人员、高级管理人员和大学受托人合作，协调筹款工作。管理美国各地的家长和新生聚会。招募、配备和管理全国家长协会董事会，并与家长协会主席合作实施募款战略。

text: DFC, like its predecessor the Overseas Private Investment Corporation (OPIC), is a federal agency that promotes global development and U.S. foreign policy objectives by catalyzing private sector investments in emerging markets. As I did with OPIC, I participate in DFC's Committees that analyze enterprise risk, that select private equity funds to support, that screen proposed transactions, and that evaluate proposed non-bank financial intermediaries. I also occasionally sit on the agency's Investment Committee, which votes on large transactions. In addition, I have helped facilitate DFC's contacts with Congress, particularly the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, the House Foreign Affairs Committee, and the Congressional Appropriations Committees. And I liaise with other parts of the federal government, such as elements of the State and Commerce Departments, and the intergovernmental Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee (TPCC). Based on these dialogues, I have participated in DFC's policy development process.
metadata: DFC与其前身海外私人投资公司（OPIC）一样，是一个联邦机构，通过促进私营部门在新兴市场的投资，促进全球发展和美国外交政策目标。正如我在OPIC所做的那样，我参加了DFC的委员会，这些委员会分析企业风险，选择私募股权基金提供支持，筛选拟议交易，并评估拟议的非银行金融中介机构。我偶尔也会参加该机构的投资委员会，该委员会对大额交易进行投票。此外，我还帮助促进了DFC与国会的联系，特别是参议院外交关系委员会、众议院外交事务委员会和国会拨款委员会。我还与联邦政府的其他部门保持联络，如州和商务部的各部门以及政府间贸易促进协调委员会（TPCC）。基于这些对话，我参与了DFC的政策制定过程。

text: ACTPN is the most senior trade policy advisory panel in the U.S. government, reporting directly to the President of the United States and the United States Trade Representative. Members of ACTPN are appointed by the President. I served on ACPTN under Presidents Bush and Obama, during a period of significant activity on trade policy and negotiations.
metadata: ACTPN是美国政府中级别最高的贸易政策咨询小组，直接向美国总统和美国贸易代表报告。ACTPN的成员由总统任命。我曾在布什总统和奥巴马总统领导下的ACPTN任职，这段时间我在贸易政策和谈判方面开展了重要活动。

text: The nation's 56 U.S. District Export Councils (DECs) are affiliated with the U.S. Department of Commerce. They mentor local companies in exporting and work with local and state public officials to promote international trade. DEC Members are appointed by the U.S. Secretary of Commerce. After my appointment to the District of Columbia-Virginia DEC, I was elected and reelected by fellow DEC members nationwide to the organization's National Steering Committee and then to its Executive Committee.
metadata: 美国56个地区出口委员会（DEC）隶属于美国商务部。他们指导当地公司进行出口，并与当地和州政府官员合作促进国际贸易。DEC成员由美国商务部长任命。在我被任命为弗吉尼亚州哥伦比亚特区DEC之后，我被DEC全国成员选举并连任为该组织的国家指导委员会成员，然后是执行委员会成员。

text: SBEA is the nation's oldest and largest trade association dedicated exclusively to small and medium-sized businesses in international trade. It is affiliated with the National Small Business Association. Founded over 75 years ago, NSBA represents more than 100,000 U.S. small businesses. SBEA handles international trade issues for these companies. During the 8-plus years that I headed it, SBEA grew markedly in membership, revenue, and stature. It accomplished many of its goals, including Congressional approval of five SBEA proposals to improve access to capital by smaller U.S. companies engaged in international trade and investment, as well as enhanced awareness of SME's in U.S. trade policy and negotiations.
metadata: SBEA是美国历史最悠久、规模最大的贸易协会，专门从事国际贸易中的中小型企业。它隶属于全国小企业协会。NSBA成立于75年前，代表着超过100000家美国小企业。SBEA为这些公司处理国际贸易问题。在我领导的8年多时间里，SBEA在会员、收入和地位方面都有了显著的增长。它实现了许多目标，包括国会批准了五项SBEA提案，以改善从事国际贸易和投资的小型美国公司获得资本的机会，并提高了中小企业在美国贸易政策和谈判中的意识。

text: MGI was an international affairs, government relations, and policy analysis consulting firm. Its clients included: the Inter-American Development Bank (Multilateral Investment Fund), Lightcom International, Raptor Systems (later merged with Symantec Corporation), the Small Business Exporters Association of the United States, the Small Business Technology Council, and the World Travel and Tourism Council.
metadata: MGI是一家国际事务、政府关系和政策分析咨询公司。其客户包括：美洲开发银行（多边投资基金）、Lightcom International、Raptor Systems（后来与Symantec Corporation合并）、美国小企业出口商协会、小企业技术理事会和世界旅游理事会。

text: Lead developer and program manager for US Army Corps Engineers primary decision support software for new flood risk management investments, which is also used extensively by foreign governments and private business. Lead climate adaptation and international water resource projects with development agencies, foreign institutions and large non governmental organizations. Principal investigator on risk assessment, system based modeling and decision making under deep uncertainty research and development funds.
metadata: 美国陆军工程兵团工程师主要决策支持软件的首席开发人员和项目经理，用于新的洪水风险管理投资，该软件也被外国政府和私营企业广泛使用。与发展机构、外国机构和大型非政府组织一起领导气候适应和国际水资源项目。在深度不确定性研发基金下，担任风险评估、基于系统的建模和决策的首席研究员。

text: - Lead Shared Vision Planning and Risk Scaled Climate Change Adaptation projects implementing integrated water resource management principals in South East Asia under the USAID funded Building Resilient Asian Cities initiative - Lead developer on systems-based Watershed Informed Budgeting initiative institutionalizing integrated water resource management principals in the prioritization of the US Army Corps civil works budget totaling approximately $5 billion annually - Serve as senior-most expert in flood risk economics for multi-billion dollar portfolio of water resource projects in 10 state region in the United States, including all of California, Arizona, New Mexico, Nevada, Utah and part of Texas, Colorado, Wyoming, Idaho and Oregon - Manage review and certification of HEC-FDA and HEC-FIA software programs, used widely by domestic and international government agencies as well as the private water resources industry - Principal Economist for multi-billion dollar portfolio of water resource infrastructure projects including the organization’s largest construction project ($2.5B) and highest priority project, a $1.5B ecosystem restoration - Trainer for agency's courses in flood risk, watershed analysis, system dynamics and economics - Received 3 promotions (GS9-11-12-13) in 4 years (3 years is minimal allowable time) Awards: Los Angeles District Emerging Leader 2011; On-the-spot Cash Awards 2009, 2010; Los Angeles District Commander’s Coins 2009, 2011; Acting Chief of Engineers Commander’s Coin 2011
metadata: -根据美国国际开发署（USAID）资助的“建设弹性亚洲城市倡议”（Building Resility Asian Cities initiative）——牵头制定基于系统的流域知情预算倡议，将综合水资源管理原则制度化，以实现美国水资源优先化，在东南亚实施共同愿景规划和风险规模的气候变化适应项目陆军陆战队土木工程预算每年约50亿美元，是美国10个州（包括加利福尼亚州、亚利桑那州、新墨西哥州、内华达州、犹他州以及德克萨斯州、科罗拉多州、怀俄明州的部分地区）数十亿美元水资源项目组合中洪水风险经济学方面的高级专家，爱达荷州和俄勒冈州-管理国内和国际政府机构以及私营水资源行业广泛使用的HEC-FDA和HEC-FIA软件程序的审查和认证-数十亿美元水资源基础设施项目组合的首席经济学家，包括该组织最大的建设项目（25亿美元）和最优先项目，一位15亿美元的生态系统恢复培训师（该机构洪水风险、流域分析、系统动力学和经济学课程的培训师）在4年内（3年是最短允许时间）获得了3次晋升（GS9-11-12-13）奖项：洛杉矶地区新兴领导者2011；2009年、2010年现场现金奖励；洛杉矶地区指挥官硬币2009、2011；代理总工程师指挥官币2011

text: - Led all aspects of temporary housing mission in support of 2011 Alabama Spring Tornados presidentially declared disaster (DR-171) - Supervised temporary housing team of 50 - 65 individuals including teams of engineers, contracting officers, database managers, GIS specialists and construction control representatives - Directed execution of $18M in federal temporary housing assistance during 45 day deployment tenure - Directed all mission actions resulting in the provision of temporary housing to over 200 families Awards: Commander’s Award for Civilian Service 2011; Mobile District Commander’s Coin 2011; National Temporary Housing Subject Matter Expert (SME) Nominee 2011; Certificates of Appreciation, Mobile District, South Atlantic Division
metadata: -领导临时住房任务的各个方面，以支持2011年阿拉巴马州春季龙卷风总统宣布的灾难（DR-171）-监督由50-65人组成的临时住房团队，包括工程师团队、合同管理人员、数据库管理人员，地理信息系统专家和施工控制代表——在45天的部署期限内，指导执行1800万美元的联邦临时住房援助——指导所有任务行动，为200多个家庭提供临时住房奖励：2011年文职指挥官奖；机动区指挥官硬币2011；2011年国家临时住房主题专家（SME）提名人；南大西洋分部莫比尔区感谢证书

text: o Research examines global production networks and R&D internationalization in high-tech industries and on industrial and innovation policies in China, the US and emerging economies, with a focus on standards and intellectual property rights. o Member of the US National Academies’ Committee on Global Approaches to Advanced Computing. o Former senior advisor, OECD, Paris; research director, Berkeley Roundtable on the International Economy, UC Berkeley; professor of international business, Copenhagen Business School; scientific advisor to governments, private companies and international institutions. o Expert advice and testimony to the US National Research Council, the US National Science Foundation, the US-China Economic and Security Review Commission, the Council on Foreign Relations, the US Council of Scientific Society Presidents, US-China Strategic and Economic Dialogue, US Science and Technology Policy Institute (STPI), US Department of Commerce, US Social Science Research Council, Deloitte Center for the Edge, Frontier Strategy Group. o Publications: America’s Voluntary Standards System – A “Best Practice” Model for Innovation Policy? (2012); Indigenous Innovation and Globalization: The Challenge for China’s Standardization Strategy (2011), China’s Innovation Policy Is a Wake-Up Call for America (2011), A New Geography of Knowledge in the Electronics Industry? Asia's Role in Global Innovation Networks (2009), Can Chinese IT Firms Develop Innovative Capabilities within Global Knowledge Networks?, (2008); Innovation Offshoring – Root Causes of Asia’s Rise and Policy Implications, 2007; China's Emerging Industrial Economy-Insights from the IT Industry, 2007; Innovation Offshoring-Asia's Emerging Role in Global Innovation Networks (2006); Complexity and Internationalization of Innovation: Why is Chip Design Moving to Asia?, 2005; "Limits to Modularity - Reflections on Recent Developments in Chip Design", 2005.
metadata: o研究考察了全球生产网络和高科技产业的研发国际化，以及中国、美国和新兴经济体的产业和创新政策，重点是标准和知识产权。o美国国家科学院高级计算全球方法委员会成员。o经合组织巴黎前高级顾问；加州大学伯克利分校伯克利国际经济圆桌会议研究主任；哥本哈根商学院国际商务教授；政府、私营公司和国际机构的科学顾问。o向美国国家研究委员会、美国国家科学基金会、美中经济与安全审查委员会、外交关系委员会、美国科学学会主席理事会、美中战略与经济对话、美国科学技术政策研究所（STPI）、美国商务部、美国社会科学研究理事会提供专家建议和证词，德勤边缘中心，前沿战略集团。o出版物：美国自愿标准体系——创新政策的“最佳实践”模式？(2012); 自主创新与全球化：中国标准化战略面临的挑战（2011），中国的创新政策是美国的警钟（2011），电子行业的新知识地理？亚洲在全球创新网络中的作用（2009），中国IT企业能否在全球知识网络中发展创新能力？，(2008); 创新离岸外包——亚洲崛起的根本原因和政策影响，2007年；《中国新兴工业经济信息技术产业洞察》，2007年；创新离岸亚洲在全球创新网络中的新兴角色（2006年）；创新的复杂性和国际化：为什么芯片设计要转移到亚洲？，2005; “模块化的限制——对芯片设计最新发展的思考”，2005年。

text: My practice emphasizes venture capital and the governing, operating, buying, selling and merging of growing technology and other businesses. My practice further encompasses corporate and business transactions, including matters relating to telecommunications, electronic commerce, energy, clean technology, biotechnology, corporate governance, employment and independent contractor issues, intellectual property protection, competitive business practices, securities, and business structuring and financing. I also have significant experience in handling contractual and political issues involving telecommunications companies and independent power producers.
metadata: 我的工作重点是风险投资以及不断增长的技术和其他业务的管理、运营、购买、销售和合并。我的业务还包括公司和商业交易，包括与电信、电子商务、能源、清洁技术、生物技术、公司治理、就业和独立承包商问题、知识产权保护、竞争性商业惯例、证券以及业务结构和融资有关的事项。我在处理涉及电信公司和独立发电商的合同和政治问题方面也有丰富的经验。

text: Indie Health provides a medical device platform with •the most highly certified •highly standardized •easiest to integrate connected-health devices in the industry Our goal is simple: Implementing international standards, we have developed a complete tool-kit with open APIs, SDKs, sample code and Apple HealthKit application to get our partners to market quickly and cost effectively. Need logistical assistance with our devices? We can provide complete forward and reverse logistics to help you manage your devices and solutions. Need help developing your applications or platform? We can provide support to help you develop applications and end-to-end platforms and provide white-labeled solutions to get you to market faster.
metadata: Indie Health提供了一个医疗设备平台，该平台具有•最高度认证•高度标准化•最容易集成行业内的联网医疗设备。我们的目标很简单：实施国际标准，我们开发了一个完整的工具包，其中包含开放的API、SDK、示例代码和Apple HealthKit应用程序，以使我们的合作伙伴快速且经济高效地推向市场。我们的设备需要后勤援助吗？我们可以提供完整的正向和反向物流，帮助您管理设备和解决方案。需要帮助开发应用程序或平台吗？我们可以提供支持，帮助您开发应用程序和端到端平台，并提供白标解决方案，让您更快地进入市场。

text: The men and women of the San Diego Police Department respond to the needs of more than 1.3 million people while facing ever increasing budget constraints. Formed in 1998, the San Diego Police Foundation helps ensure that programs critical to public interest receive funding that is not available through the City's budget. Whether it's an evidence management system, advanced video streaming and recording, or other life-saving equipment and training, the SDPF ensures that donations to the police department impact all of San Diego.
metadata: 圣地亚哥警察局的男男女女在应对130多万人的需求的同时，面临着越来越多的预算限制。圣地亚哥警察基金会成立于1998年，帮助确保对公众利益至关重要的项目获得该市预算所无法提供的资金。无论是证据管理系统、先进的视频流和录制，还是其他救生设备和培训，圣地牙哥警察局都能确保对警察局的捐款影响到整个圣地亚哥。

text: Greenbutts (http://green-butts.com) is dedicated to mitigating the environmental and economic impact of cigarette litter by offering a viable and cost effective solution to the cigarette industry and consumer. Working with one of the preeminent nonwovens research and development institutions, we have developed an all-natural, patent-pending, rapidly biodegradable filter that can be mass produced using existing filter making machinery, providing a cost effective transition for the cigarette industry. Greenbutts is committed to curbing the global blight of pollution caused by discarded cigarette butts into the environment.
metadata: 格林伯茨(http://green-butts.com)致力于通过为卷烟行业和消费者提供可行且经济高效的解决方案，减轻香烟垃圾对环境和经济的影响。我们与一家卓越的非织造布研发机构合作，开发了一种全天然、正在申请专利、可快速生物降解的过滤器，可使用现有的过滤器制造机械大规模生产，为卷烟行业提供了一种经济高效的过渡。Greenbutts致力于遏制废弃烟头对环境造成的全球污染。

text: Promoted to lead the employee engagement team in support of 45+ engagement programs and 300+ employee clubs—with a new challenge of refreshing the global employee recognition program. Surveys showed that 18% of employees were using the recognition program, while only 9% of employees felt recognized. Owned a multimillion-dollar program and philanthropy budget, and lead a team of employee engagement professionals, and contractors and consultants with expertise in global recognition and event management. I served as Program Officer for the company’s flagship arts program, and as the only senior manager on an executive-level internal communications leads team. In late 2020, I was selected for a rotational leadership assignment—the future workplace initiative—to create and implement new and responsive programs and policies that improve employees’ lives, and ensure the company emerges from the COVID-19 pandemic. Highlights of accomplishments: ► Played an integral leadership role in the design and execution of corporate values, leveraging core technology and innovation pieces to reflect changing the world, creating community, and adding value. ► Transformed the employee recognition program from paper-based to a social media program, developing a business case, securing $2M in funding, and partnering cross-functionally to develop its user experience, and ensure legal approval to distribute money and awards—and introducing a framework to further expand funding. ► Secured executive-level adoption of new engagement platform to drive increases in recognition—resulting in Senior VP or VP levels identified as high-volume users. ► Developed a formal change management plan to overcome resistance during the launch of the global recognition program, creating change agents to build momentum and onboard stakeholders. ► Established and expanded the Ambassador Program, promoting strategic initiatives and employee engagement programs, related to STEM and employee recognition.
metadata: 晋升为领导员工敬业度团队，支持45多个敬业度计划和300多个员工俱乐部，迎接刷新全球员工认可计划的新挑战。调查显示，有18%的员工使用了认可计划，而只有9%的员工感到被认可。拥有数百万美元的项目和慈善预算，领导一支由员工敬业度专业人士、承包商和顾问组成的团队，在全球认可和活动管理方面具有专业知识。我曾担任该公司旗舰艺术项目的项目主管，也是高管级内部沟通领导团队的唯一高级经理。2020年末，我被选为轮流担任领导职务的未来工作场所计划（future workplace initiative），以创建和实施新的响应性计划和政策，改善员工的生活，确保公司摆脱2019冠状病毒疾病大流行。成就亮点：► 在企业价值观的设计和执行中发挥了不可或缺的领导作用，利用核心技术和创新元素来反映世界的变化、创造社区和增加价值。► 将员工认可计划从纸面计划转变为社交媒体计划，开发商业案例，获得200万美元的资金，跨职能合作开发其用户体验，确保发放资金和奖励的法律批准，并引入进一步扩大资金的框架。► 确保高管层采用新的参与平台，以提高知名度，从而将高级副总裁或副总裁级别确定为高容量用户。► 制定了一个正式的变革管理计划，以克服全球认可计划启动期间的阻力，创建变革推动者，以建立动力和利益相关者。► 建立并扩大了大使计划，促进与STEM和员工认可相关的战略举措和员工参与计划。

text: Challenged to lead employee engagement (QLiving) programs, and drive programming around fun, family, and finances—with 35+ engagement program and 200+ employee clubs in support of 30k global employees. Role expanded to lead a team of two, and serve as the program officer for the Qualcomm Charitable Foundation—owning a multimillion-dollar budget to expand engagement programs, and lead the foundation’s arts program. Highlights of accomplishments: ► Formalized structure of employee engagement programs in three key areas—family, fun, and finance, aligning programs to families’ needs, and introducing new programs in each category, such as backup childcare and elder care, finance week, with 17 session on topics of financial literacy, Qkids programming, and family week. ► Managed the launch of several new programs, brokered new partnerships, and developed and executed standard communications, extending the reach and visibility of engagement programs both domestically and internationally. ► Aligned programs to connect science and technology with families, launching high-level author talks and building partnerships to introduce new programming, including international women’s day with keynote, Padma Lakshmi. ► Increased employee clubs in China—from zero to 30+, establishing and leading bi-monthly orientations with Chinese employees to launch clubs and increase membership.
metadata: 挑战领导员工敬业度（QLiving）计划，并通过35多个敬业度计划和200多个员工俱乐部围绕乐趣、家庭和财务推动编程，以支持30000名全球员工。该职位扩大到领导一个由两人组成的团队，并担任高通慈善基金会的项目官员，拥有数百万美元的预算来扩大参与项目，并领导该基金会的艺术项目。成就亮点：► 在家庭、娱乐和金融三个关键领域正式确定了员工参与计划的结构，使计划与家庭需求保持一致，并在每个类别中引入新的计划，如后备儿童保育和老年保育、金融周，共有17节课，主题为金融知识、Qkids计划和家庭周。► 管理了几个新项目的启动，促成了新的合作伙伴关系，开发并执行了标准通信，扩大了参与项目在国内外的影响力和可见性。► 调整项目，将科学技术与家庭联系起来，启动高级别作者对话，建立合作伙伴关系，引入新的节目，包括国际妇女节，主题是Padma Lakshmi。► 将中国的员工俱乐部从零增加到30多个，与中国员工建立并领导双月入职培训，以启动俱乐部并增加会员。

text: Challenged to lead marketing efforts to target California investors to invest in high-return residential real estate properties in Tennessee. Expanded role to include HR activities, including recruitment, hiring, and disciplinary actions, benefits, and onboarding, as well as employee manual and policies. Oversaw office operations. Hired and led a loan processor, marketing coordinator, and office manager, and owned a $250k annual budget. Highlights of accomplishments: ► Played a key leadership role in the firm’s rapid revenue growth—$5M to $12M in three years, recruiting and hiring staff, leading lead-generation, press, and branding efforts, and establishing employee policies. ► Developed and executed strategic marketing plans, launched branded lead-gen websites, and managed AdWords, and organic and paid searches, and outreach to press—leading to triple revenue growth, and recognition as one of the fastest-growing U.S. companies in Inc. 5000. ► Established the structure for six new LLCs under the company umbrella, managing and monitoring reporting and fee payments for nine entities.
metadata: 挑战领导营销工作，以加利福尼亚投资者为目标，投资田纳西州的高回报住宅房地产。扩大角色，包括人力资源活动，包括招聘、招聘和纪律处分、福利和入职，以及员工手册和政策。监督办公室运营。聘请并领导贷款处理人、市场协调员和办公室经理，并拥有25万美元的年度预算。成就亮点：► 在公司收入的快速增长中发挥了关键的领导作用，三年内收入从500万美元增长到1200万美元，招聘员工，领导潜在客户开发、新闻和品牌推广工作，并制定员工政策。► 制定并执行战略营销计划，推出品牌lead gen网站，管理广告词、有机搜索和付费搜索，以及与媒体的联系，从而实现三倍的收入增长，并被公认为股份有限公司5000中增长最快的美国公司之一。► 为公司旗下的六家新的有限责任公司建立了结构，管理和监控九家实体的报告和费用支付。

text: Challenged to live on-site and manage a living/learning community of 350+ students and scholars. Established and fostered partnerships with university departments, NGOs, community organizations, corporate partners, and government officials—to driving funding and advance strategic goals. Managed a team of 12 students, volunteers, and facilities staff, and owned a $200k annual budget. Highlights of accomplishments: ► Established the annual strategy and direction of programming, leading the planning and execution of large events with all students, and chairing the commencement committee for the entire college. ► Led the remodel of the great hall and meeting rooms, partnering closely with housing and dining teams, and building a positive and intentional space that increased exposure to co-curricular programs. ► Deepened ties with local and community-led organizations, expanding student programming to include activities in the San Diego community, versus solely on campus.
metadata: 挑战现场生活和管理350多名学生和学者的生活/学习社区。领导所有节目的开发，并指导其屡获殊荣的大厅和会议室的所有营销、活动和财务管理。与大学各部门、非政府组织、社区组织、企业合作伙伴和政府官员建立并促进伙伴关系，以推动资金筹措和推进战略目标。管理一个由12名学生、志愿者和设施工作人员组成的团队，并拥有20万美元的年度预算。成就亮点：► 制定年度规划战略和方向，领导所有学生大型活动的规划和执行，并主持整个学院的启动委员会。► 领导大会堂和会议室的改造，与住房和餐饮团队密切合作，并建立一个积极而有目的的空间，增加对课外项目的接触。► 加深与当地和社区领导组织的联系，扩大学生计划，将活动包括在圣地亚哥社区，而不仅仅是在校园内。

metadata: 太平洋地区土木和公共工程项目规划、政策和项目管理负责人。水资源注册规划师。认证机构技术审查员。与包括国会议员、州长、市长、市和县官员在内的当选官员进行地区立法联络。土木工程、机构间和国际支持以及运营和维护的项目监督。

text: • Supervise Staff of ~8 planners at all levels of career development. Recruit new talent. • Direct ~$1.5 million program of over 30 flood risk management, floodplain management, water supply, ecosystem restoration, dam safety and watershed planning studies, many of which will lead to hundreds of millions of dollars in water resource investment. • Oversee and certify the quality of staff’s technical work. Serve as national-level senior technical reviewer for analyses and reports outside of my organization, as requested. Ensure the quality of contracted work. • Recruit new work via business development and submission of project proposals. Serve on committee that submits project proposals for potential funding each year. Proposals for 2018 resulted in $2.1 billion in emergency supplemental federal funding for water resource projects to be used to design and construct flood risk management projects over the next few years. • Serve as Tribal Partnership Program Manager and Tribal Outreach Coordinator for 93 federally recognized Tribes. Develop, negotiate and execute financial agreements with Tribes to conduct studies on Tribal lands. • Lead Instructor for national “Water and the Watershed” course. metadata: •监督约8名职业发展各级规划师的工作人员。招募新人才。•30多项洪水风险管理、漫滩管理、供水、生态系统恢复、大坝安全和流域规划研究的150万美元直接项目，其中许多将导致数亿美元的水资源投资监督和认证员工技术工作的质量。根据要求，担任国家级高级技术审查员，负责组织外的分析和报告。确保承包工程的质量通过业务开发和提交项目建议书招聘新工作。担任每年提交潜在资金项目提案的委员会成员。2018年的提案为水资源项目带来了21亿美元的紧急补充联邦资金，用于在未来几年设计和建设洪水风险管理项目担任93个联邦认可部落的部落伙伴关系项目经理和部落外联协调员。与部落制定、谈判和执行财务协议，对部落土地进行研究。•国家“水与流域”课程的首席讲师。担任初级员工的导师。•国家规划劳动力发展委员会成员。

text: Eric H. Loeb supports AT&T’s international external and regulatory affairs team, which is responsible for advocacy to international departments of the US government, and all branches of government outside the US, including executive, legislative and regulatory agencies, and for international external affairs affecting AT&T and its Affiliates. Mr. Loeb’s work supports AT&T’s diverse international portfolio – fixed, mobile and satellite platforms; voice, video and broadband; and IoT solutions. AT&T is a global leader in providing integrated communications services to businesses and consumers, from video entertainment, high-speed Internet and mobility, to IP network services and the Internet of Things. It provides services in more than 220 countries and territories, including business enterprise services to countries representing over 99 percent of the world’s economy. In addition to implementing market access and compliance strategies enabling AT&T’s global expansion, Mr. Loeb’s responsibilities also include advocacy on policy matters that promote investment, innovation, and sustainable economic growth across the digital economy ecosystem.

text: ▪ Provide academic support, advice, solutions, and direction for undergraduate students in the Columbian College of Arts and Sciences (CCAS) to foster personal, academic and professional growth and success ▪ Maintain an advising load within a team and work directly with individual students to develop academic plans that accomplish their goals and ensure proper progress toward earning their degrees ▪ Conduct graduation audits, review and provide feedback on academic success plans, mock schedules, and participate in the on-boarding of new students via the New Student Orientation (NSO) process ▪ Respond to student requests for transfer credit, leaves of absence, policy exceptions, and other routine issues relating to course registration and management ▪ Master knowledge and understanding of GW’s policies, procedures, and academic curriculum ▪ Serve as a liaison between the advising office and special student populations (e.g., pre-law, pre-health, study abroad, international, transfer, first-generation, and at-risk students) ▪ Provide internal and external information, referrals, resources and opportunities for students ▪ Advise and counsel students on developing a program of study that aligns with their articulated career interests and recommend avenues of exploration to meet their goals ▪ Preserve the confidentiality and integrity of student records ▪ Work with Banner, DegreeMAP, Kronos, and other apps, interfaces and systems
metadata: ▪ 为哥伦比亚艺术与科学学院（CCAS）的本科生提供学术支持、建议、解决方案和指导，以促进个人、学术和专业的成长和成功▪ 在团队中保持一个建议量，并直接与学生个人合作制定学术计划，以实现他们的目标，并确保在获得学位方面取得适当进展▪ 进行毕业审核，审查学业成功计划、模拟时间表并提供反馈，并通过新生入学（NSO）流程参与新生入学▪ 回应学生申请转学分、请假、政策例外以及其他与课程注册和管理相关的常规问题▪ 掌握GW政策、程序和学术课程的知识和理解▪ 充当咨询办公室与特殊学生群体（例如，法律预科、健康预科、留学、国际、转学、第一代和风险学生）之间的联络人▪ 为学生提供内部和外部信息、推荐、资源和机会▪ 建议学生制定一个与他们明确的职业兴趣相一致的学习计划，并建议实现目标的探索途径▪ 保护学生记录的机密性和完整性▪ 使用Banner、DegreMap、Kronos和其他应用程序、界面和系统

text: ▪ Developed and led public policy campaigns across a wide range of policy areas that impacted Verizon, the Internet, telecommunications, and emerging technologies. Key issues included technology innovation, machine-to-machine (M2M), the Internet of Things (IoT), connected homes and cars, cloud and Internet-enabled services, privacy, security, and digital media and content ▪ Engaged directly with politicians, policy-makers, and visiting foreign officials and built a network of trade associations, industry partners, non-profit groups and others to support policies that help maintain a robust market for global enterprise technology solutions ▪ Represented Verizon externally with government, regulators and third parties, as well as at public conferences and industry fora ▪ Led the development and implementation of the company’s first human rights policy and accountability framework and aligned internal global sourcing and smart energy policies and the Supplier Code of Conduct with this new policy ▪ Drafted comments, memos, white papers, issue briefs, statements, testimony, presentations, and letters in support of ongoing advocacy efforts ▪ Prepared and delivered courses on matters relating to telecommunications to foreign nationals and other officials for the U.S. Telecommunications Training Institute (USTTI) ▪ Helped determine and staff appropriate corporate membership opportunities in industry associations and political organizations and to manage outside technical consultants ▪ Selected and managed interns and temporary staff
metadata: ▪ 在影响Verizon、互联网、电信和新兴技术的广泛政策领域开展并领导公共政策活动。关键问题包括技术创新、机器对机器（M2M）、物联网（IoT）、互联家庭和汽车、云和互联网服务、隐私、安全以及数字媒体和内容▪ 与政界人士、决策者和来访的外国官员直接接触，并建立了贸易协会、行业合作伙伴、非营利组织和其他组织的网络，以支持有助于维护全球企业技术解决方案强大市场的政策▪ 在政府、监管机构和第三方以及公共会议和行业论坛上代表Verizon▪ 领导制定和实施公司第一个人权政策和责任框架，并将内部全球采购和智能能源政策以及供应商行为准则与这一新政策相一致▪ 起草评论、备忘录、白皮书、问题摘要、声明、证词、陈述和信件，以支持正在进行的宣传工作▪ 为美国电信培训学院（USTTI）编写并向外国国民和其他官员提供有关电信事宜的课程▪ 帮助确定行业协会和政治组织中合适的企业会员机会并为其配备员工，并管理外部技术顾问▪ 挑选和管理实习生和临时员工

text: A nonprofit organization committed to global development and education, IREX has focused on people and communities since 1968. Our organization was created to bridge geopolitical divides by fostering the exchange of scholars, teachers, students, and ideas. IREX then built on our expertise and network of relationships in Eurasia to support people driving educational reform, leading newly empowered movements in civil society, and building effective and accountable governance. IREX became a leader in improving access to information technology, strengthening independent media, and empowering youth through education and leadership development. As global needs shifted, IREX brought this expertise to new regions—first Asia, then the Middle East and Africa, then Latin America. Throughout these decades of change, our focus on people and communities has been steady. Today, IREX and our partners work in more than 100 countries to build a more just, prosperous, and inclusive world by empowering youth, cultivating leaders, strengthening institutions, and extending access to quality education and information
metadata: IREX是一个致力于全球发展和教育的非营利组织，自1968年以来一直专注于个人和社区。我们的组织旨在通过促进学者、教师、学生和思想的交流，弥合地缘政治分歧。然后，IREX利用我们在欧亚大陆的专业知识和关系网络，支持人们推动教育改革，领导民间社会新的赋权运动，并建立有效和负责任的治理。IREX在改善信息技术获取、加强独立媒体以及通过教育和领导力发展赋予青年权力方面成为领导者。随着全球需求的变化，IREX将这些专业知识带到了新的地区——首先是亚洲，然后是中东和非洲，然后是拉丁美洲。在这几十年的变革中，我们对人和社区的关注一直保持稳定。今天，IREX和我们的合作伙伴在100多个国家开展工作，通过赋予青年权力、培养领导人、加强机构、扩大优质教育和信息的获取，建设一个更加公正、繁荣和包容的世界

text: USTTI training empowers developing country officials with the skills needed to manage their spectrum, deploy wireless technologies, develop national broadband plans, implement national Cybersecurity strategies, support Internet deployment, launch cloud services, protect children online, and ensure sound emergency communications plans all while working to support the rule of law. Thanks to the steadfast contributions of USTTI corporate and government board members, as well as hundreds of volunteer ICT experts from government, industry and academia throughout the United States, the USTTI has graduated 10,000 women and men in 172 developing countries
metadata: USTTI培训赋予发展中国家官员管理频谱、部署无线技术、制定国家宽带计划、实施国家网络安全战略、支持互联网部署、启动云服务、保护儿童在线以及确保健全应急通信计划所需的技能，同时努力支持法治。由于USTTI公司和政府董事会成员的坚定贡献，以及来自美国政府、行业和学术界的数百名志愿ICT专家，USTTI在172个发展中国家的10000名男女毕业生中脱颖而出

text: In this role, Karim oversees the group's Government Relations, Regulatory Affairs, Corporate Communications and ESG functions. His focus is on developing and driving Millicom’s global engagement to support of business objectives and particular responsibility for special situations and reputation strategies. Millicom (NASDAQ U.S.: TIGO, Nasdaq Stockholm: TIGO_SDB) is a leading provider of fixed and mobile services dedicated to emerging markets in Latin America and Africa. Millicom sets the pace when it comes to providing high-speed broadband and innovation around The Digital Lifestyle® services through its principal brand, TIGO. As of the end of September 2021, Millicom operating subsidiaries and joint ventures employ close to 21,000 people and provide mobile services to approximately 44 million customers, with a cable footprint of more than 12 million homes passed. Founded in 1990, Millicom International Cellular S.A. is headquartered in Luxembourg.
metadata: 在这一角色中，卡里姆负责监督集团的政府关系、监管事务、企业沟通和ESG职能。他的重点是发展和推动Millicom的全球参与，以支持业务目标以及特殊情况和声誉战略的特殊责任。Millicom（纳斯达克美国：TIGO，纳斯达克斯德哥尔摩：TIGO\U SDB）是致力于拉丁美洲和非洲新兴市场的领先固定和移动服务提供商。Millicom通过其主要品牌TIGO，围绕数字生活方式®服务提供高速宽带和创新，引领潮流。截至2021 9月底，Millicom运营子公司和合资企业雇用了近21000名员工，为大约4400万客户提供移动服务，通过的电缆覆盖面积超过1200万户。Millicom International Cellular S.A.成立于1990年，总部位于卢森堡。

text: Works with governments across the world helping them develop strategies and address issues such as ICT and development, broadband plans, IP enabled services, wireless and spectrum policy, the Internet of Things, security, privacy and Internet governance. text: Manage ICC’s Commission on the Digital Economy (formerly EBITT Commission) Built and coordinate ICC’s BASIS initiative, Business Action to Support the Information Society Facilitate policy development and consensus building processes on a broad range of Internet/ICT related issues including data protection, privacy, security, Internet and telecoms infrastructure and services Draft, negotiate, and facilitate support for global business positions and practical tools on Internet and communications infrastructure issues Coordinate cross-cutting ICT/Internet policy issues with other ICC Commissions Work with ICC’s national committees in over 120 countries to get business messages heard at national and regional levels to influence policy approaches and legislative decisions through communications efforts, advocacy, seminars and meetings with governments and relevant stakeholders Develop communications and public relations materials to promote policy and practice products and business positions for Commission and BASIS Build and drive advocacy cycle for business positions on these issues through communications efforts and advocacy vis-à-vis governments and other stakeholders Represent and speak for global business in international processes and discussions on Internet/ICT policy issues including ICANN, ITU, OECD, European Commission, Council of Europe, UNESCO and post UN World Summit on the Information Society (WSIS) activities including the Internet Governance Forum (IGF) Representative and spokesperson for business throughout the WSIS Geneva, 2003, Tunis 2005 Interface for global business interests from across sectors with international organizations, civil society, governments and technical experts and organizations Selected to serve on the UN Secretary General’s Task Force on Financial Mechanisms (TFFM) and Working Group on Internet Governance (WGIG) Selected to serve on the UN Secretary General’s multistakeholder advisory group for the IGF

text: Consulting practice focused on management improvement, planning, restructuring, turn-around and profitability increase. - Strategic Planning and Operational Roadmap for a 6yrs old company working in the mobile business application industry. Company is experimenting fast growing pace (60% CAGR) and needed advice on how to structure to cope with this growth and be able to continue to grow Revenues and EBITDA. Job was developed in four months and was completed in Jan 2013. After completion of the job, was invited (and accepted) to take part of Company's Operational Executive Board (with the two partners) to oversee sales, support the Executive decision process and keep the Strategic Planning up to date on a weekly basis. - Advise to an investor in the process of understanding the Business Strategy and Leadership team of a target company in the Environmental Industry. One month job completed by Nov 2012. Investor decided to go ahead with the intended minority position acquisition. One year latter was called to repeat the due-diligence process on another target company (in the same industry). - Plan and implementation of a turn around in a Brazilian IT company with the founders/partners with 20+ years in the market and revenues of US$30 million. Managed to turn around from loss to break-even in 5 months. Job completed on June 2013. Plan was "sold" to management and was based on cost reduction, payroll reduction by friction, debt renegotiation and increase of sales. Company became operational cash-flow positive in Aug 2013 and succeed to finish 2013 with annual EBITDA zero and positive EBITDA on the last 4 months of the year. 2014 has already a positive YTD (March) EBITDA. - Turn Around of a Car Dealership operation preparing the company for an over 50% grow in sales (in 2015) keeping a health EBITDA and CashFlow. Working directly with shareholders and Directors to implement new financial controls and monitoring.
metadata: 咨询业务侧重于管理改进、规划、重组、扭亏为盈和盈利能力的提高。-一家在移动业务应用行业工作了6年的公司的战略规划和运营路线图。该公司正在试验快速增长的速度（复合年增长率为60%），需要关于如何构建结构以应对这种增长并能够继续增长收入和息税折旧摊销前利润的建议。这项工作历时四个月完成，于2013年1月完成。工作完成后，被邀请（并接受）参加公司运营执行委员会（与两个合作伙伴一起），以监督销售，支持执行决策过程，并每周更新战略规划。-在了解环境行业目标公司的业务战略和领导团队的过程中，向投资者提供建议。2012年11月前完成一个月的工作。投资者决定继续进行预期的少数股权收购。一年后，后者被要求对另一家目标公司（同行业）重复尽职调查过程与创始人/合作伙伴一起，计划和实施一家巴西IT公司的扭亏为盈，在市场上拥有20多年的经验，收入达到3000万美元。在5个月内从亏损转为盈亏平衡。工作于2013年6月完成。该计划被“出售”给了管理层，其基础是降低成本、通过摩擦减少工资、重新谈判债务和增加销售额。公司于2013年8月开始运营现金流为正，并成功完成了2013年，年度息税折旧摊销前利润为零，并在今年最后4个月实现了正息税折旧摊销前利润。2014年年初至今（3月）息税折旧摊销前利润为正-汽车经销商业务的好转为公司销售额增长50%以上（2015年）做好了准备，保持了良好的息税折旧摊销前利润和现金流。与股东和董事直接合作，实施新的财务控制和监控。

text: NRSC is home to a key set of industry advisors on the health of the nation’s communications networks. NRSC provides timely consensus-based technical and operational expert guidance and best practices to all segments of the public communications industry. Employing a proactive approach, it collaborates and holds quarterly public meetings with the FCC and provides information to help minimize the number of agency rule-makings and mandates. Highlights: Industry Best Practices provide guidance from assembled industry expertise and experience. They are vital to the reliability of the nation's public communications networks and services. For additional information, please visit the Best Practices Website. NRSC has published a number of public industry resources, including Bulletins, Standards, and Technical Reports that address network reliability improvement opportunities. A full listing of documents is available here. NRSC Operational Report provides a snapshot of activities and issues.
metadata: NRSC是美国通信网络健康方面一组关键行业顾问的所在地。NRSC为公共通信行业的所有部门提供及时的基于共识的技术和运营专家指导和最佳实践。它采用积极主动的方法，与FCC合作并举行季度公开会议，并提供信息以帮助减少机构规则制定和授权的数量。亮点：行业最佳实践提供来自组合行业专业知识和经验的指导。它们对国家公共通信网络和服务的可靠性至关重要。有关更多信息，请访问最佳实践网站。NRSC发布了许多公共行业资源，包括公告、标准和技术报告，以解决网络可靠性改进机会。此处提供了完整的文档列表。NRSC运营报告提供了活动和问题的快照。

text: As the Deputy Director, in coordination with the Board of Directors, I am responsible for all operations and funding, and Chief-Cook-And-Bottle-Washer for the ongoing mission of the NG9-1-1 Institute, a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization that works with the Congressional NextGen 9-1-1 Caucus to provide educational support regarding technologies impacting the deployment of advanced and effective Next Generation (NG) 9-1-1 services throughout the nation. Recent Accomplishments: + Revamped all Social Media and rebuilt web site (while lowering costs 90%) + Grew stable permanent sponsorships by 25% + Lowered total expenses by over 41% while increasing vendor quality and stability + Increased caucus membership by 8% + Grew net revenue 250% + Increased public activities / event management by over 200% + Reduced per-event costs by over 67% Founded in 2003, the Institute has steadily grown in membership and influence as a valued resource for policy makers. This includes NG9-1-1 expertise spanning the public safety community and the service providers and vendors supporting 9-1-1 services. The mission of the NG9-1-1 Institute is to assist the Congressional NextGen 9-1-1 Caucus by serving as a national information clearinghouse and policy forum on NG9-1-1 issues. While not a lobbying shop, the Institute does work to educate a diverse group of stakeholders about issues important to the 9-1-1 community. The objective of the NG9-1-1 Institute is to advance the rapid implementation of NG9-1-1 systems to best ensure public safety and security. To this end, the Institute seeks to elevate NG9-1-1 issues through education with policy makers and highlight the need for sufficient and appropriate funding for NG9-1-1 systems, network, and call centers.
metadata: 作为副主任，我与董事会协调，负责所有运营和资金，并负责NG9-1-1研究所持续任务的首席厨师和洗瓶工，一个501（c）（3）非营利组织，与国会下一代9-1-1核心小组合作，就影响在全国部署先进有效的下一代（NG）9-1-1服务的技术提供教育支持。最近的成就：+更新了所有社交媒体并重建了网站（同时降低了成本90%）+稳定的永久赞助增长了25%+总费用降低了41%以上，同时提高了供应商质量和稳定性+核心小组成员增加了8%+净收入增加了250%+公共活动/活动管理增加了200%以上+每项活动成本减少了67%以上成立于年2003年，研究所的成员和影响力稳步增长，成为决策者的宝贵资源。这包括NG9-1-1在公共安全领域的专业知识，以及支持9-1-1服务的服务提供商和供应商。NG9-1-1研究所的使命是作为NG9-1-1问题的国家信息交流中心和政策论坛，协助国会下一届9-1-1核心小组。虽然该研究所不是游说机构，但它确实致力于就9-1-1社区的重要问题对不同的利益相关者群体进行教育。NG9-1-1研究所的目标是推动NG9-1-1系统的快速实施，以最好地确保公共安全。为此，该研究所寻求通过与决策者的教育提升NG9-1-1问题，并强调需要为NG9-1-1系统、网络和呼叫中心提供足够和适当的资金。

text: Our Founders gave us the world's oldest and best Constitution. Central to its nature is the recognition of America as "a nation of states" - Federalism. We elect our Presidents via 50 state elections. This sustains our nation in many ways - including a robust two-party system, and a sense of inclusion in our less populist states. The large state - small state compromise in the Constitutional Convention of 1787 - "the Connecticut Compromise" - made our Union possible. Sustain our Republic, support the Electoral College! www.CenterElectoralCollege.us
metadata: 我们的创始人给了我们世界上最古老、最好的宪法。其本质的核心是承认美国是“国家之国”——联邦制。我们通过50个州的选举选出我们的总统。这在许多方面支撑着我们的国家，包括强有力的两党制，以及在我们民粹主义较少的国家的包容感。1787年制宪会议中的大州-小州妥协——“康涅狄格州妥协”——使我们的联盟成为可能。维护我们的共和国，支持选举团！www.CenterElectoralCollege。我们

text: Universal Acceptance (UA) is a global program to make the Internet more accessible for the next billions of Internet users whose first language is not English and it's not written in Latin characters. When systems and applications are not UA ready, people using domain names or email addresses in different scripts cannot successfully use these systems, because the domain names and email addresses are not recognized or considered “invalid.” ICANN is a global public-benefit corporation with participants from all over the world dedicated to keeping the Internet secure, stable, and interoperable. ICANN coordinates the management of the Internet's naming system, it does have an important impact on the expansion and evolution of the Internet.
metadata: 普遍接受（UA）是一项全球计划，旨在让未来数十亿母语不是英语、也不是拉丁文的互联网用户更容易访问互联网。当系统和应用程序未准备好UA时，在不同脚本中使用域名或电子邮件地址的人无法成功使用这些系统，因为域名和电子邮件地址无法识别或被视为“无效”ICANN是一家全球公益性公司，其参与者来自世界各地，致力于保持互联网的安全、稳定和互操作性。ICANN负责协调互联网命名系统的管理，它确实对互联网的扩展和演变产生了重要影响。

text: Architected & established country-wide Regulatory Framework & Technical Affairs Department that oversaw Qatar’s Internet/Communications sector estimated at $2.7 B U.S. (2017), managed all technical/Internet-related policy issues, directly reported to Authority President & Minister of ICT. Regulatory Authority Establishment Built-out Operational Department, Management, Strategy, Staff hiring & socialization w/Ministries & mobile/internet operators. - Contributed to achievement of 99% Internet penetration country-wide, ranked #1 in world ("Digital in 2018") - Enabled 147% mobile service subscriptions growth to 3.5M from 1.5M per ITU ICT Development Index 2017 - Laid foundation for a spike to 70.3% from 9.6% YoY mobile broadband subscriptions w/award of 2nd mobile operator license - Supported ICT sector jump to 1.6% from 1.2% in GDP contribution (2008-2010) - Recruited 21 multi-nationals staff from 9 countries and established 5 operational units Regulatory Framework Development Devised country-wide Regulatory and Policy framework with the focus on flexibility, predictability managing communications sector growth. - Led introduction of 6 National Technology laws and policies in 4 years, including 1st eCommerce law “E-Transactions and e-Commerce Law” (2010) - Supported $2.8 B (2015) in total market revenue from Mobile/telecom and broadband Internet services contributing 1.7% of GDP - Oversaw achieving 99% broadband coverage by 2016, exceeding ambitious 95% of households targets (2013) - Spiked IPv6 utilization to 70% from 17% (2008-2013) after developed IPv6 National Implementation Strategy & Migration Plan - Scaled .QA Domain names annual growth of 25%-30%, with new Country domains Registry/Registration Policies launch Program & Project Management Led programs and projects with budgets exceeding $30M, for example establishing national mission critical systems: Numbering Management/Portability, Domain Names Registry & Telecom Infrastructure Access system.
metadata: 设计并建立了全国范围的监管框架和技术事务部，负责监督卡塔尔的互联网/通信行业，估计为27亿美元（2017年），管理所有技术/互联网相关政策问题，直接向管理局主席兼信息和通信技术部长报告。监管机构的建立包括运营部门、管理层、战略、员工招聘和社会化，以及各部委和移动/互联网运营商。-有助于实现全国99%的互联网普及率，排名世界第一（“2018年数字”）-使移动服务订阅从2017年ITU ICT发展指数的150万增长到了350万，增长了147%-为移动宽带订阅从年环比9.6%激增到70.3%，并获得了第二个移动运营商许可证-支持的ICT行业从GDP贡献的1.2%跃升到1.6%（2008-2010）-从9个国家招聘了21名跨国员工并建立了5个运营单位监管框架制定了全国范围的监管和政策框架，重点是灵活性、可预测性管理通信部门的增长在4年时间里，领导出台了6项国家技术法律和政策，包括第一部电子商务法《电子交易和电子商务法》（2010年）——支持移动/电信和宽带互联网服务的市场总收入为280亿美元（2015年），占GDP的1.7%——监督到2016年实现99%的宽带覆盖率，超过了雄心勃勃的95%家庭目标（2013年），在制定了IPv6国家实施战略和迁移计划后，IPv6利用率从17%（2008-2013年）飙升至70%。QA域名每年增长25%-30%，新的国家域注册/注册政策推出了以项目管理为主导的计划和项目，预算超过3000万美元，例如建立国家关键任务系统：编号管理/可移植性、域名注册和电信基础设施接入系统。

text: Co-led transition proposal development & delivery to NTIA Secretary on biggest governance change in Internet history - transfer of US Government stewardship oversight role on root DNS & IP address to global Internet technical community. Elected to co-chair out of group of 30 global Internet technology experts. New Global Internet Governance Model Development - Transition Proposal accepted by U.S. Government to transfer oversight to global “empowered community” model implemented by ICANN - Gained buy-in from 100’s of global organizational stakeholders, e.g. Yahoo, FB, Google, IETF, int’l Chambers of Commerce & governments - Achieved consensus agreement on the final proposal as co-Chair of IANA working group of 30 global Internet experts - Governance Model & policy implemented, ICANN’s by-laws changed & org structure revamped - Awarded ICANN Leadership award (2016)
metadata: 共同领导过渡提案的制定，并向NTIA秘书长提交互联网历史上最大的治理变革——将美国政府对根DNS和IP地址的监管职责移交给全球互联网技术社区。当选为30位全球互联网技术专家组的联合主席。新的全球互联网治理模式开发——美国政府接受的过渡建议，将监管转移到ICANN实施的全球“授权社区”模式——获得了100多家全球组织利益相关者的认可，例如雅虎、FB、谷歌、IETF、，国际商会和政府-作为由30名全球互联网专家组成的IANA工作组联合主席，就最终提案达成共识-实施治理模式和政策，修改ICANN章程和组织结构-获得ICANN领导奖（2016年）

text: TractusMed™ is creating a national anatomical pathology repository called PathGateway™, which will aggregate nearly all the anatomic pathology reports across the US. text: ScratchMyBelly.org was founded to save animals from high kill shelters all over the USA and Mexico. Our goal is to help raise funds to rehabilitate the neglected, injured and sick. In addition, we will also help perfectly healthy animals in a partnership with other rescues, in order to find them forever homes. Every year, about 10 million animals are brought to animal shelters across the USA alone, and more than 5 million of those are put to sleep, via euthanasia or gas chamber. It is an average of 10,000 per day! Economically distressed areas and the illusionary mindset that selling puppies will make one rich, are quickly brought to reality with the many costs associated with owning animals. Most back yard breeders just opt to let their animals go to the streets, and have them picked up as strays by animal control, to avoid surrender fees at the shelters. Once the animals are brought to Southern California animal shelters, they are placed on a 72 hour hold, and they are available for one day to adopters and rescues before they are PTS. It is time to end unnecessary killing of innocent animals and to voice against animal cruelty, and especially to care for the ones left to die.
metadata: 抓挠我的肚子。该组织的成立是为了拯救美国和墨西哥各地高捕杀动物收容所的动物。我们的目标是帮助筹集资金，帮助被忽视、受伤和生病的人康复。此外，我们还将与其他救援人员合作，帮助非常健康的动物，以便为它们找到永远的家园。仅在美国，每年就有大约1000万只动物被带到动物收容所，其中500多万只通过安乐死或毒气室被安乐死。平均每天10000次！经济不景气的地区和卖小狗就能致富的幻想心态很快就变成了现实，而养宠物的成本也很高。大多数后院饲养者只是选择让他们的动物走上街头，并让动物管理部门把它们作为流浪动物来饲养，以避免在收容所缴纳投降费。一旦这些动物被带到南加州动物收容所，它们将被放置在72小时的等待中，在它们被临时收容所收容之前，收养者和营救者可以使用它们一天。现在是时候结束对无辜动物不必要的杀戮，反对虐待动物，尤其是照顾那些死去的动物。

text: Leading BioSciences, Inc. (LBS) is a biopharmaceutical company that has developed a revolutionary medical platform based on the science of autodigestion. The company’s lead candidate (LB1148) is a therapeutic for severe sepsis, septic shock, and multi-organ failure. In addition, the company is developing a breath and blood diagnostic for early detection of acute shock and multi-organ failure. This therapy is part of an overall product design that includes the pharmaceutical formulation (LB1148) and the delivery device. To date, this new medical platform has produced 14 different products, therapies, and medical devices each with their own distinct patents and exclusive licenses.
metadata: Leading BioSciences，Inc.（LBS）是一家生物制药公司，开发了基于自动消化科学的革命性医疗平台。该公司的主要候选人（LB1148）是一种治疗严重败血症、败血症性休克和多器官衰竭的药物。此外，该公司正在开发一种呼吸和血液诊断仪，用于早期检测急性休克和多器官衰竭。该疗法是整个产品设计的一部分，包括药物配方（LB1148）和输送装置。到目前为止，这个新的医疗平台已经生产了14种不同的产品、疗法和医疗设备，每种产品、疗法和医疗设备都有各自的专利和独家许可。

text: Co-founder and CEO of biotech company developing novel antivirals against pandemic viral threats. Partner, Dr. Sina Bavari, was the former CSO of the US Army Medical Research Institute of Infectious Diseases (USAMRIID); he was instrumental in repurposing of Remdesivir against coronaviruses. Key Accomplishments: • Co-inventor of a new class of antivirals; filed multiple patent/PCT filings on the drugs and MOA. • Identified and developed lead candidate, a protease inhibitor and advanced abandoned asset, as an orally available antiviral and prophylaxis candidate against SARS-CoV-2. In-vitro studies show strong antiviral effects comparable or better than leading drugs including Molnupiravir, AT-527 and Favipiravir. • Created a research partnership with FUJIFILM Pharmaceuticals to co-develop a highly synergistic antiviral oral drug combination. Preliminary tests suggest combo may be broadly active against many RNA viral classes including coronaviruses, influenza and filoviruses (Ebola) at druggable oral dosing. • Raised capital and co-led grant funding efforts. Scientifically approved for two USG contracts worth over $100 million in funding (contracts on hold pending programmatic priorities) • Established collaborations with CDC, NIH, FUJIFILM, Emory U, George Mason University, University of Nebraska Medical Center, and University of Tennessee Health Science Center.
metadata: 生物技术公司联合创始人兼首席执行官，开发新型抗病毒药物，对抗大流行病毒威胁。合伙人Sina Bavari博士是美国陆军传染病医学研究所（USAMRIID）的前CSO；他在重组雷姆德西韦以对抗冠状病毒方面发挥了重要作用。主要成就：•一类新型抗病毒药物的联合发明者；就药物和MOA提交了多项专利/PCT文件确定并开发了主要候选蛋白酶抑制剂和高级废弃资产，作为口服抗病毒和预防SARS-CoV-2的候选药物。体外研究显示，强抗病毒效果可与主要药物莫鲁匹拉韦、AT-527和法维匹拉韦媲美或更好与FUJIFILM Pharmaceuticals建立研究伙伴关系，共同开发高度协同的抗病毒口服药物组合。初步试验表明，在药物口服给药的情况下，combo可能对许多RNA病毒类具有广泛的活性，包括冠状病毒、流感和丝状病毒（埃博拉）筹集资金并共同领导赠款筹资工作。科学地批准了两份价值超过1亿美元的美国政府合同（合同待定，计划优先事项）•与CDC、NIH、FUJIFILM、埃默里大学、乔治梅森大学、内布拉斯加州大学医学中心和田纳西大学健康科学中心建立了合作关系。

text: Innovation Catalysts. We drive positive change through growth and performance improvements. Serve clients in the fortune 2,000, large private companies, VC/PE funds and their portfolio businesses, and large non-profit institutions. Experience (lifetime): led 18 growth and performance improvements projects generating over $250 million in incremental profits and creating $2.5BN in value. Advised/co-led diligence on over 200 transactions including $30+BN in closed deals. Led investments of $300 million in multiple situations that has generated $2 BN in investor value. Founded, co-founded, CEO or senior advisor/investor to many digital/technology start ups including: - LocalVox/NearSay: local, social, and mobile marketing solutions (sold to Vivial) (advisor) - AtlasArena: SaaS commerce platform and digital marketplace (Co-Founder) - NetMovies: peer to peer delivery of digital media (Advisor) - NetCapital: FinTech solutions (Advisor) - Consumers Choice Media: online directory of guides for child-care services. (Co-Founder) - Magic Leap: augmented reality company (Advisor) - Fido: Film database management company (ultimately sold to Kudelski Group) (Co-Founder) - Music Marketing Network: marketing business (sold to 24/7 media) (Advisor) - Baseline: a film database business. (Sold to NYT) (Advisor) - TradeYard: marketplace for used construction equipment. (Sold to Heartland Publishing)(Founder) - Healion Bio: biotech preclinical company (Co-Founder) - NewMid LLC: coaching academy, podcast and radio show for mid-life women (advisor) - JumpCrew: outsourced sales organization (advisor)
metadata: 创新催化剂。我们通过增长和绩效改进推动积极变革。为《财富2000》杂志、大型私人公司、VC/PE基金及其投资组合业务以及大型非营利机构的客户提供服务。经验（终身）：领导了18个增长和绩效改进项目，创造了超过2.5亿美元的增量利润，创造了25亿美元的价值。为200多宗交易提供咨询/共同领导尽职调查，其中包括300多亿美元的已完成交易。在多种情况下领导了3亿美元的投资，创造了20亿美元的投资者价值。许多数字/技术初创公司的创始人、联合创始人、首席执行官或高级顾问/投资者，包括：-LocalVox/NearSay：本地、社交、，和移动营销解决方案（出售给Vivial）（顾问）-AtlasArena：SaaS商务平台和数字市场（联合创始人）-NetMovies：点对点数字媒体交付（顾问）-NetCapital：FinTech解决方案（顾问）-消费者选择媒体：儿童保育服务在线指南。（联合创始人）-Magic Leap：增强现实公司（顾问）-Fido：电影数据库管理公司（最终出售给Kudelski Group）（联合创始人）-音乐营销网络：营销业务（出售给全天候媒体）（顾问）-基线：电影数据库业务。（出售给纽约时报）（顾问）-贸易场：二手建筑设备市场。（出售给Heartland Publishing）（创始人）-Heallion Bio：生物技术临床前公司（联合创始人）-NewMid LLC：面向中年女性的教练学院、播客和广播节目（顾问）-JumpCrew：外包销售组织（顾问）

text: Unanimously elected the 25th President. Hired as a change agent to position the University for growth, improve its financial position, strengthen its Catholic identity, raise its academic reputation and become more student-centric. Directed a rigorous internal and external review of the culture, capabilities, finances, operations, market position and operating principles. Developed Mount 2.0 - a new vision for the University. The Mission: double enrollment within 10 years; become a top 10 regional school; top 25 nationally ranked Catholic University. Academic Achievements Included: - Introduced summer program at Cambridge University; JV with Cambridge Security Initiative - Initiated new academic offerings and courses based on market research - Planned new degree programs in Cyber-Security; Forensic Accounting; Entrepreneurship; PP&E; data science - Streamlined core curriculum from 68 to 49 credits - Doubled faculty devel. budget; 6.5% increase in faculty base pay Student life - Initiated a center for student success and leadership - Increased athletics programs leading to addition of over 170 new student athletes - Started Career Pathways Initiative; increased students' access to mentors and better career options - Upgraded 4 new student lounges; new state-of-the-art classrooms; Starbucks - Implemented new learning management system; new athletics training technologies - Oversaw new lecture series; held largest media event ever - Justice in America - Welcomed President Barack Obama to campus Administrative Achievements - Initiated and negotiated $100+ MM donation/JV. (largest pending expansion in history) - Eliminated $3MM of costs; reduced $12MM of liabilities - Reorganized management, hired new staff, and implemented professional processes and procedures - Introduced new technologies including Workday accounting system, student system and CRM - Collaborated on $500MM JV with FEMA for an int’l center for Emergency Management (incl. moving I-15)
metadata: 一致选举第25任总统。被聘为变革推动者，为学校的发展定位，改善其财务状况，加强其天主教身份，提高其学术声誉，并变得更加以学生为中心。指导对文化、能力、财务、运营、市场地位和运营原则进行严格的内部和外部审查。开发了Mount 2.0-大学的新愿景。使命：10年内实现双招生；成为十大地区性学校；全国排名前25的天主教大学。学术成就包括：-在剑桥大学推出暑期课程；与Cambridge Security Initiative合资，根据市场研究发起新的学术课程和课程，计划新的网络安全学位课程；法务会计；创业；PP&E；数据科学——将核心课程从68学分简化为49学分——使师资发展翻了一番。预算教师基本工资增长6.5%学生生活-启动了学生成功与领导力中心-增加了田径项目，增加了170多名新的学生运动员-启动了职业途径计划；增加学生获得导师的机会和更好的职业选择——升级了4个新的学生休息室；最先进的新教室；星巴克-实施新的学习管理系统；新的田径训练技术——监督新的系列讲座；举办了有史以来规模最大的媒体活动-美国司法-欢迎巴拉克·奥巴马总统取得校园管理成就-发起并协商了1亿多美元捐款/合资企业。（历史上最大的未决扩张）-消除了300万美元的成本；减少了1200万美元的负债——重组了管理层，雇佣了新员工，实施了专业流程和程序——引进了新技术，包括Workday会计系统、学生系统和CRM——与FEMA合作，为国际应急管理中心（包括移动I-15）建立了5亿美元的合资企业

text: Execution oriented advisory firm with strong transformation, strategy and profit improvement focus. Extensive experience in marketing, branding, manufacturing operations and service or product delivery. Clients have included AT&T, Viacom, Universal, EMECO, British Airways, Hyundai, Affinity Group, Camping World, Tata, Jamba Juice, HealthTronics and numerous smaller firms. Managed multi-disciplinary teams tackling hard to solve strategic and operational problems. Strong implementation focus including extensive use of data analytics. Implemented many creative solutions that frequently involve a complete redefinition of the core business, a change in the organization of the company, a re-focusing of performance metrics, and the implementation of new technologies. CMG Capital Partners, LLC is a private equity investment company.
metadata: 以执行为导向的咨询公司，专注于转型、战略和利润提升。在营销、品牌、制造运营和服务或产品交付方面有丰富经验。客户包括美国电话电报公司（AT&T）、维亚康姆（Viacom）、环球（Universal）、EMECO、英国航空公司（British Airways）、现代（Hyundai）、亲和集团（Affinity Group）、露营世界（Camping World）、塔塔（Tata）、Jamba Juice、HealthTronics和许多小型公司。管理多学科团队，解决难以解决的战略和运营问题。强大的实施重点，包括广泛使用数据分析。实施了许多创造性的解决方案，这些解决方案通常涉及对核心业务的全面重新定义、公司组织的变革、对绩效指标的重新关注以及新技术的实施。CMG Capital Partners，LLC是一家私募股权投资公司。

text: One of two managing directors of a Private Equity firm targeting investments in companies worth between $50 and $500 million. Invested $75 million in four portfolio companies to date.

metadata: 为航空航天和空间技术公司提供知识产权、资本筹集和增长战略方面的指导。

More importantly, we help them expand their client base and revenue through the relationships we’ve built across many industries.

text: The Senior Science Advisor, Chief Data Officer, and Director, Special Programs Office—a member of the NIST leadership team—is responsible for strategic, operational, and programmatic priorities, including cross-cutting special programs (open data, greenhouse gas measurements, forensic science). Served as Senior Science Advisor to the Deputy Secretary of Commerce (2013-17). Provided leadership to plan/manage the Return on Investment (ROI) Initiative to advance the President's Management Agenda. This whole-of-government initiative was designed to maximize returns to the Nation from the $150 B/yr Federal R&D investment by assessing, streamlining, and accelerating the transfer of technology from Lab-to-Market. The 15 key findings from the ROI Final Green Paper are being implemented via changes to legislation, regulations, policies, and practices. Key contributor to the Commerce Department’s "Open for Business" Strategic Plan, advancing its Innovation, Data, Operational Excellence Goals. Strengthened Department’s capacity as America’s Data Agency by focusing its data strategy and establishing its first Chief Data Officer position / Data Advisory Council. As chair of a specially appointed Departmental Oversight Board, transformed the National Technical Information Service, a Commerce bureau, repositioning it to meet a 21 century national need by delivering innovative data services through joint venture partnerships with the private sector. Transformed the Commerce Department's Office of Chief Information Officer via new leadership and significantly improved service delivery, network infrastructure, cybersecurity, governance. Developed Export Controls Management framework to fit NIST’s unique R&D mission; implemented new consensus policies, procedures, capabilities. Developed all-hazards Incident Management Playbook to coordinate NIST response to protect its people, assets, operations, environment; the playbook guided NIST response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
metadata: 高级科学顾问、首席数据官和特别项目办公室主任（NIST领导团队成员）负责战略、运营和计划优先事项，包括交叉特别项目（开放数据、温室气体测量、法医学）。担任商务部副部长高级科学顾问（2013-17）。领导规划/管理投资回报（ROI）计划，以推进总裁的管理议程。整个政府举措旨在通过评估、精简和加速技术从实验室向市场的转移，最大限度地提高联邦每年150亿美元研发投资对国家的回报。投资回报率最终绿皮书中的15项关键发现正在通过改变立法、法规、政策和实践来实施。商务部“面向商业开放”战略计划的主要贡献者，推进其创新、数据、卓越运营目标。通过聚焦其数据战略和建立其第一个首席数据官职位/数据咨询委员会，加强了国防部作为美国数据机构的能力。作为一个特别任命的部门监督委员会的主席，对国家技术信息服务局（一个商务局）进行了改造，通过与私营部门的合资伙伴关系提供创新的数据服务，对其进行重新定位，以满足21世纪的国家需求。通过新的领导层和显著改进的服务提供、网络基础设施、网络安全和治理，改变了商务部首席信息官办公室。制定出口管制管理框架，以适应NIST独特的研发任务；实施新的共识政策、程序和能力。制定所有危险事件管理行动手册，以协调NIST的响应，保护其人员、资产、运营和环境；该手册指导NIST应对2019冠状病毒疾病大流行。

text: Led and managed a $90 M/yr organization with over 400 federal staff and guest researchers from industry, university, and foreign laboratories. EL promoted innovation and industrial competitiveness for advanced manufacturing and construction. Together with Laboratory staff and managers, developed / executed a broad portfolio of laboratory-based strategic goals and research / technology programs with resources aligned to support three national priorities: 1. Smart Manufacturing and Cyber-Physical Systems to (1) rethink the manufacturing process with advanced technologies, specifically robotics, additive manufacturing, networked controls, supply chain interoperability; (2) accelerate convergence of secure networking and information technologies with engineered physical systems for smart (cyber-physical) systems in manufacturing, transportation, utility grids, and buildings. 2. Sustainable Energy-Efficient Systems to (1) accelerate achievement of net-zero energy, high performance buildings with advanced energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies; (2) enable creation of high-performance materials through advances in service life prediction and reduced energy materials. 3. Disaster-Resilient Communities to reduce the risk of (1) fires in buildings and in wildland-urban interface communities, and increase the safety effectiveness of firefighters; and (2) earthquakes, hurricanes, tornadoes, other natural / manmade hazards in buildings / infrastructure / communities. Established NIST’s Cyber-Physical Systems (Industrial Internet-of-Things) program, which is pioneering collaborative research, challenge competitions, testbeds, standards development for IIoT with industry, academia, communities. Appointed to NY State Governor's Ready Commission after Hurricane Sandy to improve the strength / resilience of infrastructure to withstand weather incidents (2012-2013).
metadata: 领导和管理一个每年9000万美元的组织，拥有400多名联邦工作人员和来自工业、大学和国外实验室的客座研究人员。EL促进了先进制造业和建筑业的创新和产业竞争力。与实验室工作人员和管理人员一起，制定/执行了一系列基于实验室的战略目标和研究/技术项目，其资源与支持三个国家优先事项相一致：1。智能制造和网络物理系统（1）用先进技术重新思考制造过程，特别是机器人技术、增材制造、网络控制、供应链互操作性；（2） 加快安全网络和信息技术与工程物理系统的融合，以实现制造、运输、公用电网和建筑中的智能（网络物理）系统。2、可持续节能系统：（1）加速实现净零能耗、采用先进能效和可再生能源技术的高性能建筑；（2） 通过使用寿命预测和节能材料的进步，创造高性能材料。3、抗灾社区，以降低（1）建筑物和荒地-城市界面社区的火灾风险，并提高消防员的安全效率；（2）地震、飓风、龙卷风、建筑物/基础设施/社区中的其他自然/人为危害。建立了NIST的网络物理系统（工业物联网）计划，该计划开创了与工业、学术界和社区的合作研究、挑战赛、试验台、IIoT标准开发。飓风桑迪过后，被任命为纽约州州长预备委员会成员，以提高基础设施的强度/韧性，抵御天气事件（2012-2013年）。

text: Led and managed a $47 M/yr organization with over 300 federal staff and guest researchers from industry, university, foreign laboratories. BFRL promoted U.S. innovation and industrial competitiveness for the $1.1 T/yr construction industry. As Lead Investigator for the Federal Building and Fire Safety Investigation of the World Trade Center Disaster in the aftermath of the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, led largest U.S. building failure investigation ever conducted, involving over 200 NIST staff and private sector experts. More than 40 major and far reaching changes were adopted in U.S. building / fire codes based on NIST WTC recommendations within a record 5-year period. Delivered over 50 featured talks on the WTC investigation to large conference audiences in the U.S. and abroad. Thirty-five NIST participants received largest group Gold Medal ever awarded by the U.S. Department of Commerce. Established lead agency function and led oversight of the National Earthquake Hazards Reduction Program (NEHRP), a $130 M/yr multi-agency federal program (2004). Provided interagency leadership for enactment of National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act (2004); lead agency designation (2015). Established Federal R&D Agenda for Net-Zero Energy High-Performance Buildings via leadership of White House National Science & Technology Council’s Buildings Technology R&D Subcommittee. Partnered with Construction Industry Institute to help create FIATECH Consortium and realize vision to Fully Integrate and Automate Project Process (1999-2000). Chair, Interagency Committee on Seismic Safety in Construction (1999-2011); U.S.-side Chair, Wind and Seismic Effects Panel, U.S.-Japan Cooperative Program on Natural Resources (1999-2004). Prior BFRL positions: Deputy Director (2004-06); Chief, Materials and Structural Systems Division (1998-2004); Manager, High-Performance Construction Materials and Systems Program (1994-96).
metadata: 领导和管理一个每年4700万美元的组织，拥有300多名联邦工作人员和来自工业、大学、外国实验室的客座研究人员。BFRL促进了美国1.1吨/年建筑业的创新和产业竞争力。作为2001年9月11日恐怖袭击后世贸中心灾难联邦建筑和消防安全调查的首席调查员，领导了有史以来规模最大的美国建筑故障调查，涉及200多名NIST员工和私营部门专家。在创纪录的5年内，根据NIST WTC的建议，美国建筑/消防规范进行了40多项重大而深远的修改。向美国和国外的大型会议观众发表了50多场关于世贸中心调查的专题演讲。35名NIST参与者获得了美国商务部颁发的最大团体金牌。建立了牵头机构职能，并牵头监督了国家地震灾害减少计划（NEHRP），这是一个1.3亿美元/年的多机构联邦计划（2004年）。为颁布《国家减少风暴影响法案》（2004年）提供跨部门领导；牵头机构名称（2015年）。通过白宫国家科学技术委员会建筑技术研发小组委员会的领导，制定了净零能耗高性能建筑的联邦研发议程。与建筑业协会合作，帮助创建FIATECH财团，并实现项目过程完全集成和自动化的愿景（1999-2000年）。建筑抗震安全机构间委员会主席（1999-2011）；U、 美国-日本自然资源合作项目（1999-2004）风和地震影响小组美方主席。BFRL之前的职位：副主任（2004-06）；材料和结构系统司司长（1998-2004）；高性能建筑材料和系统项目经理（1994-96）。

text: Program Analyst (6/1996-3/97); Senior Program Analyst (3/1997-12/97). As Senior Analyst, served as deputy for principal staff office for NIST Director. Served as Program Office Director in acting capacity intermittently over six-week period. Served as liaison to the Manufacturing Extension Partnership and the Building and Fire Research Laboratory. Conducted comprehensive study of NIST diversity efforts, based on which the Executive Board (now the NIST Leadership Board) adopted a new NIST diversity policy, a new Diversity Board charter, and established a diversity program manager position. Coordinated program, policy, planning, analysis support; prepared briefings for new NIST leaders; assisted with continuity of operations during several transitions in Commerce Department and NIST executive management. Assisted NIST Director and Budget Office over the entire budget cycle in planning and establishing program priorities for NIST’s FY 1999 budget, including a major new capital facilities improvement program.
metadata: 项目分析员（1996年6月至1997年3月）；高级项目分析师（1997年3月-1997年12月）。作为高级分析员，担任NIST主任主要员工办公室副主任。在六周的时间内间歇担任项目办公室主任。担任制造扩展合作伙伴关系和建筑与消防研究实验室的联络人。对NIST多样性工作进行了全面研究，在此基础上，执行委员会（现为NIST领导委员会）通过了新的NIST多样性政策、新的多样性委员会章程，并设立了多样性项目经理职位。协调项目、政策、规划、分析支持；为新的NIST领导人准备简报；在商务部和NIST执行管理层的几次过渡期间，协助保持运营的连续性。在整个预算周期内，协助NIST主任和预算办公室规划和确定NIST 1999财年预算的计划优先事项，包括一项重大的新资本设施改进计划。

text: Led large, multi-disciplinary S&T projects sponsored by U.S. industry/federal government in offshore, arctic, earthquake engineering; engineering systems design/computation; multi-hazard performance of structural systems; risk assessment, uncertainty analysis, stochastic processes, and digital signal processing. Provided leadership for MIT winning one of five Centers of Excellence from 1,000 proposals in national competition organized by Standard Oil Company of Ohio (1983). Created--and served as Associate Director of--MIT’s Center for Scientific Excellence in Offshore Engineering (1983-93). This multi-disciplinary multi-investigator 10-yr program significantly advanced arctic offshore engineering. Conducted/supervised research: (1) on performance of structural systems and materials: processing of strong-motion earthquake signals; dynamics of fixed offshore structures; ice mechanics and ice-structure interaction; (2) to develop physics-based models for simulating mechanical behavior of structural systems (offshore structures, strong-motion earthquake accelerographs) and rate-sensitive brittle materials (polycrystalline ice). Published over 80 technical articles in refereed journals, proceedings of refereed conferences, other major publications, internal reports, edited book. Delivered over 50 invited talks to industry, academia, government audiences in the U.S. and internationally. Supervised thesis research of more than 40 master’s/doctoral students. Consultant to major companies/organizations and peer reviewer for 17 journals and for research sponsoring agencies. Served on U.S. National Academy of Sciences Committee on Cooperation with USSR on Ice Mechanics (91-92); Six-member panel to evaluate U.S. Navy’s Submarine Arctic Structures Program (91-92); Department Executive Council (93-94), Strategic Planning Committee (92-93), several faculty/Department Head search committees.
metadata: 领导美国工业/联邦政府在近海、北极、地震工程领域赞助的大型多学科科技项目；工程系统设计/计算；结构系统的多危险性能；风险评估、不确定性分析、随机过程和数字信号处理。领导麻省理工学院在俄亥俄州标准石油公司（1983年）组织的全国竞赛中，从1000份提案中赢得五个卓越中心之一。创建并担任麻省理工学院海洋工程科学卓越中心（1983-93）副主任。这项多学科、多研究人员的10年计划大大推进了北极海洋工程。开展/监督研究：（1）结构系统和材料性能：强震信号处理；固定式海洋结构物动力学；冰力学与冰-结构相互作用；（2） 开发基于物理的模型，用于模拟结构系统（海洋结构物、强震加速度计）和速率敏感脆性材料（多晶冰）的力学行为。在评审期刊、评审会议记录、其他主要出版物、内部报告、编辑书籍上发表了80多篇技术文章。向美国和国际上的工业界、学术界和政府听众发表了50多场受邀演讲。指导40多名硕士/博士生的论文研究。主要公司/组织顾问，17种期刊和研究赞助机构的同行评论员。曾在美国国家科学院冰力学与苏联合作委员会任职（91-92）；评估美国海军潜艇北极结构项目的六人小组（91-92）；系执行委员会（93-94）、战略规划委员会（92-93）、多个教员/系主任搜寻委员会。

text: Strategic planning and creative problem-solving for businesses in the commercialization and monetization of intellectual property assets worldwide, such as licensing program design, transaction support and commercialization strategy.

text: Specialist in Intellectual Property analysis, valuation and monetization/commercialization. metadata: 知识产权分析、估价和货币化/商业化方面的专家。从《财富》100强到初创公司，再到单个发明人专利持有人，为众多组织的专利商业化创造了可观的收入。通过仔细分析和定向营销，释放专利的潜在价值。专业：知识产权审计和评估、专利战略制定和执行、专利代理和货币化、专利销售和许可、专利诉讼支持、专利组合管理和专利发展委员会管理、创业、风险领导、业务发展、并购尽职调查、初创企业、战略联盟和研发管理。经常在大学、贸易团体、当地商业团体发表演讲，并出现在美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）上。

text: Global Prior Art is one of the world's premier IP research and analytics firms. Founded in 1982 by Bruce Rubinger, GPA is a 30 year old, 50 person, international firm headquartered in Boston,with research teams in Germany, France, Russia, China and Japan. GPA's primary business is performing Prior Art Searches for Invalidity and Re-Exam. But in addition GPA has developed strengths in Freedom to Operate, Patentability, Accelerated Exams, State of the Art, Due Diligence and IP Landscape Analysis. Clients report comments like: GPA single-handedly saved our company by finding the prior art that kept us in business to GPA generated the single most actionable information we received from any outside vendor. GPA's technically focused teams have backgrounds in Software & E-Commerce, Mechanical Engineering, Semiconductors & Electronics, Telecom & Network Managements, Drug Delivery, Medical Devices and Biotechnology. GPA typical clients include Leading Law Firms, Corporate IP Attorneys and Joint Defense Groups.
metadata: Global Previous Art是世界一流的知识产权研究和分析公司之一。GPA成立于1982年，由布鲁斯·鲁宾格（BruceRubinger）创立，是一家30岁、50人的国际公司，总部位于波士顿，在德国、法国、俄罗斯、中国和日本设有研究团队。GPA的主要业务是进行现有技术无效性搜索和重新检查。但除此之外，GPA在操作自由、可专利性、加速考试、最新技术、尽职调查和知识产权前景分析方面也发挥了优势。客户报告的评论如下：GPA一手拯救了我们的公司，因为它找到了让我们保持业务的现有技术，而GPA生成了我们从任何外部供应商那里收到的最具可操作性的信息。GPA专注于技术的团队拥有软件与电子商务、机械工程、半导体与电子、电信与网络管理、药物输送、医疗器械和生物技术等领域的背景。GPA的典型客户包括领先的律师事务所、企业知识产权律师和联合辩护团体。

text: Synchrony Innovations has developed the first of its kind software platform for the Enterprise Management of R&D, Corporate Venturing, M&A, and several other functional areas. This proprietary SaaS solution is just going into Beta, and will be offered commercially in Q4. I am working with Synchrony to present this opportunity to the R&D community. In my varied career I have worked at 5 significantly different R&D organizations from a start-up pursuing Fiber Optic advances in the 80s to Rockwell Scientific, the corporate R&D center for Rockwell International, most recently. I was also a member of GTE's Corporate Venturing group at their Telephone Operations headquarters in Dallas, TX.
metadata: Synchrony Innovations为研发、企业创业、并购和其他几个功能领域的企业管理开发了第一个同类软件平台。这个专有的SaaS解决方案刚刚进入测试阶段，将于第4季度商业化提供。我正与Synchrony合作，向研发界介绍这一机会。在我不同的职业生涯中，我曾在5家截然不同的研发机构工作，从80年代追求光纤发展的初创公司到最近的罗克韦尔国际公司研发中心罗克韦尔科学公司。我也是位于德克萨斯州达拉斯电话运营总部的GTE公司风险投资集团的成员。

Now offering the HCG diet, one of our clients has lost 30 lbs in 40 days for an average weight loss of 2/3 of lb daily, with minimal exercise and no hunger.
metadata: 波士顿首家非侵入性、非手术超声波身体塑形、皮肤紧致、暂时性脂肪团去除和身体塑形治疗中心。出现在“医生”电视节目、YouTube和Facebook上。Oz博士认可的为数不多的非手术塑身技术之一。现在提供HCG饮食，我们的一位客户在40天内减掉了30磅，平均每天减重2/3磅，只需少量运动，不需要饥饿。

text: Research in the design, synthesis and purification of novel crystalline organic semiconductors for use in field-effect transistors, light emitting diodes and solar cells. metadata: 制药行业研究与创新委员会学术秘书。职责范围包括研究政策和创新、基础研究、战略研究计划、研究资金、公共和私人研究之间的合作、制定和实施战略优先事项和项目。个人公共职责，任命和代表任务：-欧洲制药工业协会研究委员会成员-高等教育和研究部研究特别委员会成员-卫生部医生教育预测和规模确定委员会成员-桥梁-转化卓越执行教育委员会成员项目-哥本哈根大学科学院用户委员会成员-奥尔堡大学医学院用户委员会成员-生物人（丹麦创新网络）指导委员会成员

metadata: 为开发和商业化NMX的组织制定战略方向™ 从电厂废水中去除有毒硒的吸收介质溶液。建立技术团队，扩大生产运营规模，筹集资金。主要成就：2016年国家清洁技术公开赛（最佳水公司、最佳技术和最佳商业模式）和落基山地区2016年清洁技术公开赛荣获杰出奖。在SXSW Eco和SXSW Interactive上展示。

text: I have retired from 18 years of law firm partnership to establish my own freelance advisory and consulting service. Retaining my certification to practise law, I will focus on strategic advice to research institutions, life sciences/technology ventures and those who invest in them, on issues of IP portfolio management, deal structuring/negotiation, and business/R&D strategy relating to my specialty in IP law. text: The Governor’s Council vets and approves judicial nominations for the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. The Governor’s Council quizzes potential judges chosen by Governor Charlie Baker, and approves or denies Baker’s nomination. There are 411 judges and 85 clerk-magistrates in the Commonwealth, and the Governor’s Council is responsible for voting on the nominees for these judicial positions when openings occur. In addition to the selection of judges, the Massachusetts Governor’s Council reviews and approves nominations to the Parole Board, the Appellate Tax Board, the Industrial Accident Board and the Industrial Accident Reviewing Board. The Council also approves the appointments of notaries public and justices of the peace. The Council plays a vital role in modification of the sentences of prisoners in Massachusetts. If Governor Baker recommends paroles, pardons, or commutations of sentences, the Governor’s Council reviews and approves these recommendations. Richard Baker is running for election in November 2018 in the 5th Governor's Council District, a district that includes Lowell, Lawrence, Haverhill, Peabody, Gloucester, Beverly, Newburyport, Amesbury, and a number of smaller towns in northeastern Massachusetts.
metadata: 州长委员会审查并批准马萨诸塞州联邦的司法提名。州长委员会对州长查理·贝克（CharlieBaker）挑选的潜在法官进行测试，并批准或拒绝贝克的提名。英联邦共有411名法官和85名书记官，总督委员会负责在空缺出现时对这些司法职位的候选人进行投票。除了挑选法官外，马萨诸塞州州长委员会还审查和批准假释委员会、上诉税务委员会、工伤事故委员会和工伤事故审查委员会的提名。委员会还批准任命公证人和治安法官。该委员会在修改马萨诸塞州囚犯的判决方面发挥着至关重要的作用。如果贝克总督建议假释、赦免或减刑，总督委员会将审查并批准这些建议。理查德·贝克（Richard Baker）将于2018年11月在第五州长委员会选区竞选，该选区包括洛厄尔（Lowell）、劳伦斯（Lawrence）、哈弗希尔（Haverhill）、皮博迪（Peabody）、格洛斯特（Gloucester）、贝弗利（Beverly）、纽伯里港（Newburyport）、艾姆斯伯里（Amesbury）以及马萨诸塞州东北部的一些小镇。

text: Casa Healthcare, a TCAK Capital & Management company, specializes in helping primary care providers get their annual wellness visits done for their Medicare patients as well as other medical screenings required by various healthcare payers. By sending nurse practitioners or other skilled medical personnel to the patient's home, the Casa House Call can result in a far more comprehensive assessment of a patient's health situation than an office visit. In addition to being part of the paradigm shift from fee for service medicine to value based medicine, the Casa House Call allows primary care providers comply with MIPS/MACRA regulations and can generate over $100,000 in new revenue annually. All of this while improving the quality of care provided to patients across the board.
metadata: Casa Healthcare是一家TCAK资本和管理公司，专门帮助初级保健提供者为其医疗保险患者进行年度健康检查，以及各种医疗付款人要求的其他医疗筛查。通过派遣执业护士或其他熟练的医疗人员到患者家中，Casa上门拜访可以比办公室拜访更全面地评估患者的健康状况。Casa House Call不仅是从收费医疗向价值医疗模式转变的一部分，还允许初级保健提供者遵守MIPS/MACRA法规，每年可产生超过10万美元的新收入。所有这一切都在全面提高为患者提供的护理质量。

text: TechLaw LLP is a boutique intellectual property and business law firm based in Southern California. Our practice covers all areas of intellectual property and business law including patent and trademark prosecution, due diligence, opinion practice, licensing, corporate transactional work and litigation. We are experienced intellectual property attorneys with advanced degrees in a variety of scientific and engineering disciplines permitting us to work with virtually any technology. In addition to our deep technical working knowledge, our attorneys have hands on entrepreneurial experience permitting us to offer a unique perspective to our clients when providing legal advice. Given the recent phenomenon of globalization and the nature of intellectual property, we also are equipped to manage our clients’ matters worldwide through a network of foreign associates. At the same time, our unique business model allows us to offer an agile, individualized and affordable service that clients cannot find elsewhere. TechLaw LLP is a new economy law firm rooted in the business needs of today’s American and foreign-based businesses.
metadata: TechLaw LLP是一家位于南加州的精品知识产权和商业律师事务所。我们的业务涵盖知识产权和商法的所有领域，包括专利和商标起诉、尽职调查、意见实践、许可、公司交易工作和诉讼。我们是经验丰富的知识产权律师，拥有各种科学和工程学科的高级学位，允许我们使用几乎任何技术。除了我们深厚的技术工作知识外，我们的律师还拥有丰富的创业经验，使我们能够在提供法律咨询时为客户提供独特的视角。鉴于最近的全球化现象和知识产权的性质，我们还可以通过一个外国联营公司网络来管理全球客户的事务。同时，我们独特的商业模式使我们能够提供客户在其他地方找不到的灵活、个性化和价格合理的服务。TechLaw LLP是一家立足于当今美国和外国企业业务需求的新经济律师事务所。

text: Co-founder and chairman of GreenBiz Group Inc., creator of GreenBiz.com as well as research reports and events at the intersection of corporate sustainability and clean technology; columnist and weekly podcast host; lead author of the annual "State of Green Business" report. Most recent book: "THE NEW GRAND STRATEGY: Restoring America's Prosperity, Security & Sustainability in the 21st Century" (St. Martin's Press, 2016).
metadata: GreenBiz Group Inc.联合创始人兼董事长，GreenBiz的创始人。com以及企业可持续发展和清洁技术交叉点的研究报告和活动；专栏作家和每周播客主持人；年度“绿色商业状况”报告的主要作者。最新著作：《新大战略：在21世纪恢复美国的繁荣、安全和可持续性》（圣马丁出版社，2016年）。

Grainger, Waste Management, Wells Fargo, Workday and Xerox. text: Author or co-author of more than a dozen books, including THE NEW GRAND STRATEGY: Restoring America's Prosperity, Security and Sustainability in the 21st Century (St. Martin's Press); Strategies for the Green Economy (McGraw-Hill); The E-Factor: The Bottom-Line Approach to Environmentally Responsible Business (Random House); Beyond the Bottom Line: Putting Social Responsibility to Work for Your Business and the World (Simon & Schuster); and The Green Consumer (Penguin Books). Also: Woodstock: The Oral History (Doubleday). Wrote weekly syndicated column, The Green Consumer, distributed by Universal Press Syndicate. Contributor to wide range of publications, including the New York Times, Washington Post, Washingtonian, Harvard Business Review, Family Circle, and Whole Earth Review.
metadata: 十多本书的作者或合著者，包括《新大战略：在21世纪恢复美国的繁荣、安全和可持续性》（圣马丁出版社）；绿色经济战略（麦格劳·希尔）；“电子因素：对环境负责的企业的底线方法”（兰登书屋）；“超越底线：为您的企业和世界履行社会责任”（Simon&Schuster）；和绿色消费者（企鹅图书）。此外：“伍德斯托克：口述历史”（Doubleday）。撰写环球新闻集团发行的每周联合专栏“绿色消费者”。为多种出版物撰稿，包括《纽约时报》、《华盛顿邮报》、《华盛顿时报》、《哈佛商业评论》、《家庭圈》和《全球评论》。
