text: AmiCOUR IP Group links industry luminaries and experts together to provide premier, broad based engineering, scientific, and financial intellectual property consulting services for law firms, corporations, research institutions, and independent research professionals. The company specializes in IP litigation services, license compliance advisory, and royalty auditing services. Broadway's Bandstand, directed by Tony award winning choreographer Andy Blankenbuehler (Hamilton), opened in late April 2017 starring Laura Osnes and Tony nominee Corey Cott. The Fathom Events film of our stage production showed nationwide, recouped for investors, and continues to lead touring excitement. Bandstand received 7 Drama Desk and 2 Tony nominations, winning Best Choreography. Academy Award winner Mark Rylance starred in Tony nominated Farinelli and the King, driving our Broadway engagement to a full investor recoupment in just 4 months. Private investments span a broad spectrum and include, but are not limited to, early stage technology development.
metadata: AmiCOUR知识产权集团将业界知名人士和专家联系在一起，为律师事务所、公司、研究机构和独立研究专业人士提供卓越、基础广泛的工程、科学和金融知识产权咨询服务。该公司专门从事知识产权诉讼服务、许可证合规咨询和特许权使用费审计服务。百老汇音乐台由托尼获奖编舞安迪·布兰肯布埃勒（汉密尔顿）执导，于2017年4月下旬开业，由劳拉·奥斯内斯和托尼提名人科里·科特主演。我们舞台制作的《英寻事件》（Fathom Events）电影在全国上映，为投资者带来回报，并继续引领巡演激情。乐队获得了7项戏剧桌面奖和2项托尼奖提名，赢得了最佳编舞奖。奥斯卡金像奖得主马克·赖伦斯（MarkRylance）主演了托尼提名的法里内利（Farinelli）和《国王》（the King），使我们在百老汇的合作在短短4个月内实现了投资者的全额补偿。私人投资范围广泛，包括但不限于早期技术开发。

text: Served as Chairman followed by serving in the emeritus position of Past Chair. Our High Tech Sector grew to become the largest group in attendance at the LES Annual Meeting in Toronto.

metadata: 该公司为企业、独立研究人员、大学和私人投资者提供技术商业化服务和知识产权咨询。该公司服务于软件、搜索引擎、生物识别、IT安全、超级计算、银行/支付卡、在线促销、游戏和光学科学市场。服务包括临时首席执行官服务、新产品设计和发布管理以及知识产权保护战略的制定和执行，包括管理国际专利战略。

text: InnovAito is a pre-eminent patent monetization advisory service turning inactive patents into revenues. Our proprietary approach to patent portfolio analysis unlocks tremendous value for our clients looking for competitiveness in the market. We are a think tank providing services for creation of highest quality patents from inventions, utilizing cutting edge artificial intelligence tool and machine learning at the patent claims level. We have an experienced team that has unlocked the revenue potential from multibillion dollar research budgets and worked with Fortune 500 companies, universities and SMEs. InnovAito (Aito is Japanese for open) delivers a simple yet effective way of partnering with academic research enterprises to enrich research and IP portfolio. InnovAito has worked with numerous universities around the world in the area of technology transfer and commercialization. We partner with Fortune 500/100 companies to reveal novel areas of value that are not immediately obvious, such as field of use out-licensing in other technical verticals. We use consultants and advisors who are absolutely the best in the business. InnovAito works outside the practice of patent law to add synergistic value to a company’s patent prosecution and legal due diligence expertise.
metadata: InnovAito是一家卓越的专利货币化咨询服务公司，将非活动专利转化为收入。我们专有的专利组合分析方法为我们寻求市场竞争力的客户提供了巨大的价值。我们是一个智囊团，利用尖端人工智能工具和专利申请层面的机器学习，为发明创造最高质量的专利提供服务。我们拥有一支经验丰富的团队，从数十亿美元的研究预算中挖掘收入潜力，并与《财富》500强企业、大学和中小企业合作。InnovAito（Aito在日语中是open的意思）提供了一种与学术研究企业合作的简单而有效的方式，以丰富研究和知识产权组合。InnovAito在技术转让和商业化领域与世界各地的许多大学合作。我们与《财富》500强/100强公司合作，揭示一些新的价值领域，例如其他垂直技术领域的使用许可。我们聘请的顾问和顾问绝对是业内最好的。InnovAito从事专利法以外的工作，为公司的专利起诉和法律尽职调查专业知识增加协同价值。

text: Crown Electrokinetics' technology helps the planet by making buildings more sustainable. This is achieved in two ways. One, it lowers a building owner’s energy consumption by controlling the amount of light, and therefore heat, that enters a room. Two, DynamicTint is powered by solar strips, further reducing carbon emissions. As the leader in retrofit smart glass, Crown boasts a unique financial profile to investors. Without needing to replace existing glass, Crown’s addressable market is significantly larger than that of competing smart glass offerings. Furthermore, DynamicTint is highly scalable and enjoys attractive margins since it’s manufactured with abundant, inexpensive materials.
metadata: Crown Electrokinetics的技术通过使建筑更具可持续性来帮助地球。这可以通过两种方式实现。首先，它通过控制进入房间的光照量和热量来降低建筑业主的能耗。第二，DynamicInt由太阳能电池板供电，进一步减少了碳排放。作为智能玻璃改装领域的领导者，皇冠对投资者而言拥有独特的财务状况。在不需要更换现有玻璃的情况下，皇冠的目标市场明显大于竞争对手的智能玻璃产品。此外，DynamicInt具有高度的可扩展性，并且由于其使用丰富、廉价的材料制造，因此具有诱人的利润率。

text: ➢ Designed and created an IP strategy course for graduate students in business and engineering ➢ Partnered with the USPTO to offer training to students ➢ Published articles on patent valuation and IP policy in peer reviewed journals The Master of Business & Science degree (MBS) is part of a national movement of Professional Science Master’s programs that brings together master’s level study in science or engineering with “plus” courses in business and policy. Rutgers is the only university in New Jersey that offers a statewide Master of Business and Science degree . The degree is a combination of an MS and MBA degree with 43 credits: 24 credits in the sciences and/or engineering and 19 credits in business. The science courses are taken in concentrations in areas such life science, engineering management, mathematics, information technology and sustainability. This degree spans many of the areas of expertise at Rutgers on all three campuses.
metadata: ➢ 为商业和工程专业的研究生设计并创建了知识产权战略课程➢ 与美国专利商标局合作，为学生提供培训➢ 在同行评议期刊上发表了关于专利评估和知识产权政策的文章商业与科学硕士学位（MBS）是国家专业科学硕士项目运动的一部分，该项目将科学或工程硕士研究与商业和政策的“附加”课程结合在一起。罗格斯大学是新泽西州唯一一所提供全州商业和科学硕士学位的大学。该学位是理学硕士和工商管理硕士学位的结合，共有43个学分：科学和/或工程专业24个学分，商业专业19个学分。科学课程集中在生命科学、工程管理、数学、信息技术和可持续发展等领域。该学位涵盖罗格斯大学所有三个校区的许多专业领域。

text: President & Chair, Board of Governors: 2019 Chair-Elect, Board of Governors: 2018 Board Member since October, 2014 The Certified Licensing Professional (CLP) credentialing program is a professional designation intended to distinguish individuals who have demonstrated experience, proficiency, knowledge and exposure to the licensing and commercialization of intellectual property in all of its forms.
metadata: 总裁兼董事会主席：2019年当选主席，董事会主席：2018年董事会成员自2014年10月起，认证许可专业人员（CLP）认证计划是一项专业指定，旨在区分具有经验、熟练程度、，对各种形式的知识产权的许可和商业化的了解和接触。

text: Reinventing the patent process with TurboPatent®: TurboPatent enables patent professionals and corporations to double their patent output and increase their patent quality. text: As President and CEO of AZBio, the Arizona BioIndustry Association, I lead an organization that serves as the unified voice of the bioscience industry in Arizona. AZBio strives to make Arizona a place where bioscience organizations can grow and succeed. It accomplishes this by creating a forum for the bioscience community to join together, educating policy makers and the public, influencing public policy, and advancing the economic interests of individual organizations as well as the sector as a whole. From new advancements in producing the food we eat, to the business and science of healthcare and on to the newest developments in energy, the biosciences and the bioindustry shape the way we live and through bioindustry innovation we all live better. AZBio is the coming together of great organizations and individuals: great companies, research institutions, incredible university partners and committed people.
metadata: 作为亚利桑那州生物产业协会AZBio的主席兼首席执行官，我领导的组织是亚利桑那州生物科学产业的统一声音。AZBio努力使亚利桑那州成为生物科学组织能够成长和成功的地方。它通过创建一个论坛，让生物科学界联合起来，教育决策者和公众，影响公共政策，促进单个组织以及整个部门的经济利益来实现这一目标。从生产我们吃的食物的新进展，到医疗保健的商业和科学，再到能源的最新发展，生物科学和生物产业塑造了我们的生活方式，通过生物产业创新，我们都生活得更好。AZBio汇集了伟大的组织和个人：伟大的公司、研究机构、令人难以置信的大学合作伙伴和忠诚的人。

text: • Leading Project and Program Management for a major semiconductor Business Line driving multi-billon dollar revenues and hundreds of millions of dollars of R&D spend every year. • Providing hands on guidance to program managers and to cross functional program teams (marketing, architecture, analog and digital design, test and product engineering, quality engineering and FAB, test and assembly engineering) for driving progress on semiconductor New Product Introduction (NPI) deliverables. • Closely focused on regular metrics driven improvement of schedule, budget and scope performance for the entire project portfolio. • Direct ownership for the PMO leadership and for performance reviews of the project managers. • Leading portfolio wide presentations to the C-suite, project reviews, resource planning, risk management and lessons learned. • Driving creation and implementation of NPI governance, metrics, templates, resource planning, budgeting and tools implementation. • Guiding risk analysis, lessons learned and phase gate methodology initiatives. • Direct engagement with a Tier 1 Mobile OEM customer. • Successfully lead multiple audit defenses for ISO9000, CMMI & other certifications. • NXP wide responsibilities for program governance discipline and for the school of program management. • Business line wide responsibility for export licenses, for new tools user acceptance testing and deployment for IP Protection and for data privacy. • Hands on expertise in Microsoft Project, Business Case Development, SciForma & Primavera.

text: Hybrid Causal Dynamical Models for Time Series with Combinations of Segmentation Rules Refined by Unsupervised Learning, Partial Delay Differential Equations for Interrogating Domain Knowledge and Machine Learning Techniques for Finding First and Second Order Relationships. Automated presentation of the most statistically significant KPIs, along dimensions with maximal information content change in Finance, ERP and HCM Enabling "citizen" data science by automating what can be reliably automated through statistics and machine learning, including, 1. Stream ingestion, cleaning, linking/joining, transformation 2. Large scale hypothesis generation about first and second order relationships 3. Presenting visualizations with maximal information content (entropy maximization) with natural language search and query on visualizations/models using domain specific virtual personal assistants that understand business synonyms, analytical synonyms and abbreviations. 4. Generating a guided path to creating stat/math models with semi-automated model training, cross-validation and selection, for multiple industry verticals, including physics and chemistry based simulations in electrical engineering, chemical engineering, industrial maintenance, quality and reliability. Challenges: a. Enabling scientific model selection for specific datasets, enabling temporal shifting of data in modeling to account for real world processes which are never instantaneous (this creates an embarrassingly parallel but extremely large combinatorial explosion) and avoiding overfitting. b. Accounting for extreme events outside of model boundary conditions. For instance, fraud, anomalies, loss risk, errors, adverse events, delays cannot be detected by mere machine learning reflecting the past onto the current data - ensembles of old-school expert systems, dynamic mathematical models, network and graph theoretic models, and run-of-the-mill machine learning.
metadata: 时间序列的混合因果动力学模型，结合了无监督学习细化的分段规则、用于询问领域知识的偏延迟微分方程和用于发现一阶和二阶关系的机器学习技术。自动显示最具统计意义的KPI，以及财务、ERP和HCM中信息内容变化最大的维度，通过自动化可通过统计和机器学习可靠自动化的内容，实现“公民”数据科学，包括1。流摄取、清洗、链接/连接、转换2。关于一阶和二阶关系的大规模假设生成3。使用理解业务同义词、分析同义词和缩写词的领域特定虚拟个人助理，通过自然语言搜索和查询可视化/模型，呈现具有最大信息量（熵最大化）的可视化。4、为多个垂直行业（包括电气工程、化学工程、工业维护、质量和可靠性方面基于物理和化学的模拟）创建统计/数学模型，并提供半自动模型培训、交叉验证和选择的指导路径。挑战：a.实现特定数据集的科学模型选择，实现建模中数据的时间转移，以解释从不瞬时的真实世界过程（这会造成令人尴尬的并行但极大的组合爆炸），并避免过度拟合。b、 考虑模型边界条件以外的极端事件。例如，欺诈、异常、损失风险、错误、不良事件、延迟不能通过将过去反映到当前数据上的机器学习来检测，这些数据包括老式专家系统、动态数学模型、网络和图论模型以及普通机器学习。

text: 1. Automation of Fisher's Exact test, Chi-Square test (with Upton and Yates' corrections), Standard Deviation for Impact Ratio within Hiring, Promotions, and Terminations with Student's t-test for salary, for Equal Employment Opportunity Adverse Impact for Gender and Race/Ethnicity. 2. Research on developing large scale near-realistic Monte-Carlo simulations to create extreme volume, velocity and variety datasets for product POCs using domain knowledge driven distributions seeded by industry data, including Human Capital Management, Customer Relationship Management (Social, Mobile, CX), ERP, Manufacturing, and Supply Chain Management. 3. Large scale Monte Carlo simulations (prediction) within boundary conditions with manipulable independent variables to find optimal directions for action (prescription)
metadata: Fisher精确检验、卡方检验（加上Upton和Yates的修正）的自动化，雇佣、晋升和终止中影响比的标准偏差，以及学生工资的t检验，以及平等就业机会对性别和种族/族裔的不利影响。2、研究开发大规模近似真实的蒙特卡罗模拟，以使用行业数据播种的领域知识驱动分布创建产品POC的极端体积、速度和多样性数据集，包括人力资本管理、客户关系管理（社交、移动、CX）、ERP、制造和供应链管理。3、边界条件下的大规模蒙特卡罗模拟（预测），具有可操作的自变量，以找到最佳的行动方向（处方）

text: Developing Solutions to Three Grand Challenges: a. Zero Down Time, Zero Intrusion, Zero Loss] Can we provide highly reliable temporally relevant information in people's work context on their mobile devices today? What if we can prevent equipment failure by predicting maintenance or replacement needs? What if we can give pre-summarized predictions and recommendation with seamless data provenance to technicians? What if we can predict risk for a fire by connecting the condition of a boiler, simulating it with the ambient? b. Zero Waste, Zero Delay - Just In Time Supply Chain: Can our sensors in the supply chain prevent food waste, Rx/Dx misuse, detect counterfeiting, predict manufacturing requirements from orders online, and propagate the requirements up the supply chain all the way to suppliers? c. N=1 Personalization: What if we present information and enable actions relevant to the context (location, role, social circumstance, access level) of the users? Can we provide adaptive home security to learn from regular family behaviors, and detect the unusual through heat, light and audio signals? Can we minimize energy loss and optimize energy usage by predicting when certain water or air temperature patterns are needed? What if people can seamlessly use our devices to build consumer services accessible from ubiquitous mobile devices?
metadata: 开发解决方案以应对三大挑战：零停机时间、零入侵、零丢失]今天，我们能否在人们的移动设备上提供与工作环境高度可靠的临时相关信息？如果我们可以通过预测维护或更换需求来防止设备故障，该怎么办？如果我们可以向技术人员提供具有无缝数据来源的预先总结的预测和建议，会怎么样？如果我们可以通过连接锅炉的状况，模拟周围环境来预测火灾风险，那会怎么样？b、 零浪费、零延迟-准时供应链：我们在供应链中的传感器能否防止食物浪费、Rx/Dx误用、检测假冒、从在线订单预测制造要求，并将要求在供应链上一直传播给供应商？c、 N=1个性化：如果我们提供信息并启用与用户上下文（位置、角色、社会环境、访问级别）相关的操作，会怎么样？我们能否提供自适应的家庭安全，从正常的家庭行为中学习，并通过热、光和音频信号检测异常情况？我们能否通过预测何时需要特定的水温或气温模式来最大限度地减少能量损失和优化能源使用？如果人们可以无缝地使用我们的设备来构建可从无处不在的移动设备访问的消费者服务呢？

text: Researched and developed thin Si packaging at low cost in the System-on-Chip segment for smartphones (Atom processors), with major savings in test software/hardware and time to market. Designed complete assembly testchips from 65 nm to 32 nm. Created design rules for FCxGA packages and lead design of the second-generation 32 nm SRAM testchip package for SOCs. Delivered ultra-low cost Si test hardware and software platform solution with electromechanical actuators and ultra-fine precision nanotechnology equipment, and enabled next generation System-on-Chip products. Directed a team of research and development experts across two continents with design engineers, external programmers, electrical engineers, process engineers, to design, develop and deliver assembly test chips.
metadata: 在智能手机（Atom处理器）的片上系统领域，以低成本研发了薄硅封装，大大节省了测试软件/硬件和上市时间。设计了从65纳米到32纳米的完整组装测试芯片。创建了FCxGA封装的设计规则，并领导了针对SOCs的第二代32 nm SRAM测试芯片封装的设计。提供超低成本Si测试硬件和软件平台解决方案，配备机电执行器和超精密纳米技术设备，并支持下一代系统芯片产品。带领一支横跨两大洲的研发专家团队与设计工程师、外部程序员、电气工程师、工艺工程师一起设计、开发和交付组装测试芯片。

text: The Investors of Color (IoC) is a national network of diverse, accredited investors across the capital stack committed to building wealth for and by underrepresented communities through syndicated investments in early-stage companies. The IoC is composed of over 800 investors representing the entire continuum of capital such as angel investors, ad-hoc investment networks, venture capital, revenue-based investment firms, family offices, and other capital providers. The strength of IoC is a commitment to close the funding gap in startup capital.
metadata: 有色投资者（IoC）是一个由不同的、经过认证的投资者组成的全国性网络，他们致力于通过对早期公司的银团投资，为代表性不足的社区创造财富。国际奥委会由800多名投资者组成，他们代表着整个资本体系，如天使投资者、特别投资网络、风险资本、基于收入的投资公司、家族理财办公室和其他资本提供者。国际奥委会的优势在于致力于缩小创业资本的资金缺口。

text: The mission of KnowledgeBridge International Inc. Is to build connections between those who need and those who know. KnowledgeBridge International is built on four pillars. The first is an intimate understanding of need -- whether you are in need of a technology -- or in need of a connection -- we can help you to define what you need -- so that your search for assistance is easier. Second, we help to facilitate connections -- to potential customers and to potential partners. Third, we help to bring technologists together to solve needs that we are aware of -- and that may represent novel opportunities. Finally, when we discover particular niches of extraordinary need that are unlikely to be served by anyone else, we seek to build partnerships and develop products to meet those hidden needs.
metadata: KnowledgeBridge International股份有限公司的使命是在有需要的人和有知识的人之间建立联系。KnowledgeBridge International建立在四大支柱之上。首先是对需求的深入了解——无论您是需要技术还是需要连接——我们可以帮助您定义您需要什么——以便您更容易地寻求帮助。其次，我们帮助促进与潜在客户和潜在合作伙伴的联系。第三，我们帮助将技术专家聚集在一起，解决我们意识到的需求，这可能代表着新的机遇。最后，当我们发现其他人不太可能满足的特殊需求时，我们会寻求建立合作伙伴关系并开发产品来满足这些隐藏的需求。

text: MCRLab members are working under the leadership of Prof. Abdulmotaleb El Saddik on the convergence of multimedia technologies for the creation of Digital Twins in order to enhance the quality of life of citizens. Our 5 Pillars of research are: 1) Artificial Intelligence (ML/DL, Ontologies) 2) Cyber security (Biometrics and water marking) 3) IoT and Social Network (Hard and Soft sensory data) 4) Multimedia Interactions (Haptics, AR/VR, Humanoid Robotics, Audio, video) 5) Quality of Experience (and services) powered communication networks (5G and Tactile Internet)
metadata: MCRLab成员在Abdulmotaleb El Saddik教授的领导下，致力于多媒体技术的融合，以创造数字双胞胎，从而提高公民的生活质量。我们的5大研究支柱是：1）人工智能（ML/DL，本体论）2）网络安全（生物特征和水标记）3）物联网和社交网络（硬感知和软感知数据）4）多媒体交互（触觉、AR/VR、仿人机器人、音频、视频）5）体验质量（和服务）驱动的通信网络（5G和触觉互联网）

text: Vision: The vision of the Medical Devices Innovation Institute (MDII) is to be the Canadian leader in intelligent wellness systems and services’ innovation, research and development, and training to enhance the wellbeing of citizens in Canada and around the globe. Mission: MDII fosters collaboration among the key stakeholders to address targeted medical device needs, find solutions to sector specific barriers and challenges, and drives the development of leading edge innovative wellbeing systems and talent, ultimately bringing innovative ideas from concept to deployment. MDII is harnessing Ottawa science and engineering capabilities and the Ottawa health and medical community to create a core of excellence to: a) Research: producing high quality interdisciplinary research related to the wellbeing of citizens with particular reference to Internet of Things and multi-sensory data; Intelligent and cognitive analytics; and Human Interaction with digital media.; b) Training: encouraging the development of HQP providing a nurturing environment for our higher degree research students, including: a) graduate diploma/certificate; b) entrepreneurship training with focus on wellness devices and regulatory related to Health Canada; c) Services: holding a yearly meeting (workshop/forum) to bridge the gap between academia and industry in wellness systems and offering short courses for industry around wearable technologies, software, medical IT, machine learning (big-data), augmented/virtual reality, and decision-making in connected health settings;
metadata: 愿景：医疗器械创新研究所（MDII）的愿景是成为加拿大智能健康系统和服务创新、研发和培训的领导者，以增进加拿大和全球公民的福祉。使命：MDII促进关键利益相关者之间的合作，以满足有针对性的医疗设备需求，找到针对特定行业障碍和挑战的解决方案，并推动前沿创新福利系统和人才的发展，最终将创新理念从概念带到部署。MDII正在利用渥太华科学和工程能力以及渥太华健康和医疗社区创建一个卓越的核心：a）研究：制作与公民福祉相关的高质量跨学科研究，特别是物联网和多感官数据；智能和认知分析；以及人类与数字媒体的互动。；b） 培训：鼓励HQP的发展，为我们的高等学位研究生提供培养环境，包括：a）研究生文凭/证书；b） 创业培训，重点是加拿大健康设备和相关监管；c） 服务：举行年度会议（研讨会/论坛），弥合学术界和业界在健康系统方面的差距，并围绕可穿戴技术、软件、医疗IT、机器学习（大数据）、增强/虚拟现实和互联健康环境中的决策，为业界提供短期课程；

text: Founding dean and lead academic officer of the Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication at Arizona State University. Responsible for a team of nearly 400 full-time and part-time faculty and staff, 2,500 students in 10 degree programs and a $26 million annual operating budget. Transformed Cronkite from a struggling program to one of the nation’s leading journalism schools, with students winning major professional awards such as Emmys and the Alfred I. duPont-Columbia University Award. Increased fundraising by more than 1,000 percent, with more than $75 million in new gifts. Named top journalism dean by the Association for Education in Journalism and Mass Communication. Championed the “teaching hospital” model in journalism education nationally through a series of 15 new full-immersion programs, highlighted by Cronkite News, a unique learning environment that also serves as a major news outlet for Arizona on digital and broadcast platforms and a testbed for the news industry. Launched eight new degree programs on the undergraduate, master’s and doctoral levels, including highly successful all-online degrees. Brought to the school Arizona PBS, the Donald W. Reynolds National Center for Business Journalism, the Carnegie-Knight News21 digital journalism initiative, the Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowship for journalists and the Society of American Business Editors and Writers. Recruited nationally recognized faculty, including the former top editor of the Washington Post and five Pulitzer Prize winners, tripled the faculty and dramatically increased diversity. Created a Spanish-language news specialization and increased ethnic and geographic diversity across the student body. Drove retention rates that are now the highest at the university. Led planning, design and execution for the school’s new 225,000-square-foot home. Built partnerships with major media companies and other institutions such as Mayo Clinic, Facebook and New America.
metadata: 亚利桑那州立大学沃尔特·克朗凯特新闻与大众传播学院创始院长兼首席学术官。负责一支由近400名全职和兼职教职员工、10个学位项目的2500名学生组成的团队，以及2600万美元的年度运营预算。克朗凯特从一个苦苦挣扎的项目转变为美国领先的新闻学院之一，学生们获得了艾美奖和阿尔弗雷德·I·杜邦哥伦比亚大学奖等重大专业奖项。筹款增加了1000%以上，新增礼品7500多万美元。被新闻与大众传播教育协会任命为顶级新闻系主任。通过一系列15个新的全浸式课程，在全国范围内倡导新闻教育中的“教学医院”模式，Cronkite News强调了这一模式，这是一个独特的学习环境，也是亚利桑那州在数字和广播平台上的主要新闻渠道，也是新闻行业的试验台。推出了八个新的本科、硕士和博士学位课程，包括非常成功的所有在线学位。参加了亚利桑那州公共广播服务学院、唐纳德·W·雷诺兹国家商业新闻中心、卡内基骑士新闻21数字新闻倡议、休伯特·H·汉弗莱记者奖学金以及美国商业编辑和作家协会。招聘了全国公认的教师，包括《华盛顿邮报》前首席编辑和五位普利策奖获得者，使教师人数增加了三倍，并显著增加了多样性。创建了西班牙语新闻专业化，并增加了学生群体的种族和地理多样性。推动了大学目前最高的保留率。领导学校新225000平方英尺住宅的规划、设计和实施。与主要媒体公司和梅奥诊所、脸书和新美国等其他机构建立合作关系。

text: CEO of the university-owned public media outlet, the seventh-largest PBS station in the nation. text: Lead university executive for a dynamic and fast-growing decade-old campus in the heart of Phoenix, the nation’s fifth-largest city. text: Fulbright Specialist digitization, planning, and project identification consultation for the National Museum of Bosnia and Herzegovina, (www.zemaljskimuzej.ba), in Sarajevo, Bosnia from April 19 to May 29, 2016. Founded in 1888, the Museum closed on October 4, 2012. After almost 3 years, thanks to protection of the collections by a dedicated but unpaid staff, a substantial public campaign generating public and political support, and efforts of the diplomatic community and local NGO AKCIJA, the National Museum reopened September 15, 2015. The Museum employees and AKCIJA were awarded the Europa Nostra for extraordinary unpaid work, to keep the museum accessible. To help reestablish the scale and scope of the museum programs, consultants including USAID and the Smithsonian Institution have visited the museum and generated recommendations. My role was to help explore potential technological capabilities to assist in organizing, cataloging, conserving, and exhibition of cultural heritage materials; and identify pilot projects and motivate collaborative efforts within, and ideally across institutions. The larger goal was to find ways for the National Museum of Bosnia and Herzegovina to effectively contribute to reenergizing the economy, and to improve the overall quality of life through appreciation of the significant cultural heritage in Bosnia and Herzegovina and the region. My thanks to all involved including: the Fulbright Specialist Program of the Council for International Exchange of Scholars (CIES) and Institute of International Education (IIE) (Carmel Geraghty, Danielle Fultz), the U.S. Embassy (Drew Giblin, Stefanie Altman-Winans, Elizabeta Delalic), the National Museum (Director Mirsad Sijaric, Azra Becevic Sarenkapa, and Ivana Dautović), Cultural Heritage without Borders, AKCIJA, Martin Pammer and the Austrian, Italian and Turkish Embassies, USAID, Networks and Jasna Basic, and Fulbrighters Mel Flanagan, Diana Cordileone, and Lexi Hartley.
metadata: 2016年4月19日至5月29日，波斯尼亚和黑塞哥维那国家博物馆富布赖特专家数字化、规划和项目识别咨询（www.zemaljskimuzej.ba），位于波斯尼亚萨拉热窝。该博物馆成立于1888年，于2012年10月4日关闭。近三年后，由于专职但无报酬的工作人员对藏品进行了保护，开展了大量的公众运动，获得了公众和政治支持，外交界和当地非政府组织AKCIJA作出了努力，国家博物馆于2015年9月15日重新开放。博物馆员工和AKCIJA因其出色的无偿工作而获得了欧罗巴Nostra奖，以保持博物馆的可访问性。为了帮助重建博物馆项目的规模和范围，包括美国国际开发署（USAID）和史密森学会（Smithsonian Institution）在内的顾问参观了博物馆并提出了建议。我的职责是帮助探索潜在的技术能力，以协助组织、编目、保存和展示文化遗产材料；并确定试点项目，激励机构内部以及最好是跨机构的协作努力。更大的目标是为波斯尼亚和黑塞哥维那国家博物馆找到途径，有效地促进经济的重新振兴，并通过欣赏波斯尼亚和黑塞哥维那和该区域的重要文化遗产来提高整体生活质量。感谢所有相关人员，包括：国际学者交流委员会（CIES）和国际教育学院（IIE）的富布赖特专家项目（Carmel Geraghty、Danielle Fultz）、美国大使馆（Drew Giblin、Stefanie Altman Winans、Elizabeta Delalic）、国家博物馆（馆长Mirsad Sijaric、Azra Becevic Sarenkapa和Ivana Dautović），文化遗产无国界组织（Cultural Heritage without Borders）、AKCIJA、Martin Pammer和奥地利、意大利和土耳其大使馆、美国国际开发署（USAID）、Networks和Jasna Basic、富布赖特人梅尔·弗拉纳根（Fulbrighters Mel Flanagan）、戴安娜·科迪利昂（Diana Cordileone）和莱西·哈特利（Lexi。

It is a Native American-owned small business specializing in highly technical services to a growing list of well-respected clients.

text: CRDF Global is an independent nonprofit organization that promotes international scientific and technical collaboration through grants, technical resources, training and services. CRDF Global is based in Arlington, Virginia with offices in Moscow, Russia; Kyiv, Ukraine; Almaty, Kazakhstan; and Amman, Jordan.
metadata: CRDF Global是一个独立的非营利组织，通过拨款、技术资源、培训和服务促进国际科技合作。CRDF Global总部位于弗吉尼亚州阿灵顿，在俄罗斯莫斯科设有办事处；乌克兰基辅；哈萨克斯坦阿拉木图；约旦安曼。

text: Science Foundation Arizona (SFAz) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization launched in 2006 by the Greater Phoenix Leadership Inc., the Southern Arizona Leadership Council and the Flagstaff Forty in conjunction with the executive and legislative branches of state government. SFAz serves as a catalyst for high-wage, knowledge-based jobs and economic diversity through the administration and strict oversight of research, development and education grants to public education and other non-profit research performing institutions. Since 2006, SFAz has invested nearly $120 million in 142 grants in strategic research areas and education. In 2008, SFAz launched the STEM Initiative with operational funding from Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold Foundation. SFAz has also invested more than $36 million in multiple STEM education programs to build a pipeline of talent. This includes $18 million at the K-12 and community level and another $18 million to develop more than 260 Graduate Research Fellows at Arizona's three research universities. Funding comes from Arizona's 21st Century Fund, the State Board of Education for Math / Science Achievement Grants and the Governor's Office of Economic Recovery. SFAz programs have impacted 8,000 K-12 teachers and 314,000 K-12 students throughout Arizona, improving math and science teaching and learning in skills critical to a vibrant, globally competitive economy.
metadata: 亚利桑那州科学基金会（SFAz）是一个501（c）（3）非营利组织，由大凤凰城领导公司、南亚利桑那州领导委员会和Flagstaff四十联合州政府行政和立法部门于2006年成立。SFAz通过管理和严格监督公共教育和其他非营利研究执行机构的研究、开发和教育拨款，促进高薪、知识型工作和经济多样性。自2006年以来，SFAz在142项战略研究领域和教育拨款中投入了近1.2亿美元。2008年，SFAz在自由港麦克莫兰铜金基金会的运营资助下启动了STEM倡议。SFAz还投资了3600多万美元在多个STEM教育项目中，以建立人才管道。其中包括K-12和社区层面的1800万美元，以及在亚利桑那州三所研究型大学培养260多名研究生研究员的1800万美元。资金来自亚利桑那州21世纪基金、州数学/科学成就教育委员会和州长经济复苏办公室。SFAz项目在亚利桑那州影响了8000名K-12教师和314000名K-12学生，提高了数学和科学的教与学技能，这些技能对充满活力的全球竞争经济至关重要。

text: As Director of the Center for Scholarship and Research Engagement at Regis University I am a resource for faculty in all things research related. With the help of my talented colleague I supervise all aspects of academic grants, research compliance, and research administration for the University. Along with these goals I provide mentorship and training opportunities in how to conduct research and to successfully manage a research portfolio. Finally, I maintain my basic research into the analysis of cultures, symbols, and spaces both in the past and today.
metadata: 作为里吉斯大学（Regis University）奖学金和研究参与中心（Center for Scholarship and Research Engagement）的主任，我是所有与研究相关的教员的资源。在我才华横溢的同事的帮助下，我监督了大学学术拨款、研究合规性和研究管理的各个方面。除了这些目标之外，我还提供了指导和培训机会，以了解如何开展研究和成功管理研究组合。最后，我保持对过去和今天的文化、符号和空间分析的基础研究。

text: As an Assistant Research Professor I perform two separate but related functions. First, I work with the Associate Dean for Research in the Herberger Institute for Design and the Arts to promote and integrate the arts into the broader research culture at Arizona State University. Second, I direct the research portfolio of the Synthesis Center, a research enterprise that incorporates responsive media environments into social scientific research and policy analysis. In both positions I organize teams of researchers from different sectors and disciplines across the academy and unite them in pursuit of shared goals.
metadata: 作为助理研究教授，我履行两项独立但相关的职能。首先，我与Herberger设计与艺术学院研究副院长合作，促进艺术并将其融入亚利桑那州立大学更广泛的研究文化。其次，我领导综合中心的研究组合，该研究中心是一家将响应性媒体环境纳入社会科学研究和政策分析的研究企业。在这两个职位上，我组织了来自学院不同部门和学科的研究人员团队，并将他们团结在一起，追求共同的目标。

text: As research manager for the Culture Health Environment Laboratory I facilitated multiple projects, ensured that tasks occurred on deadline, and monitored equipment and facilities to keep them ready for shifting work demands. A major part of my job was the supervision and mentorship of a cohort of approximately 20 undergraduate students. I also conducted primary research on issues related to health and social justice as a member of research teams.
metadata: 作为文化健康环境实验室的研究经理，我推动了多个项目，确保任务按时完成，并监控设备和设施，使其为不断变化的工作需求做好准备。我的主要工作是监督和指导大约20名本科生。作为研究小组成员，我还对与健康和社会公正相关的问题进行了初步研究。

text: Leading MBA students through critical periods of academic studies to enhance their understanding of strategic and tactical global business planning. Helping students develop Leadership competencies critical to the success of future business needs while remaining true to a passion of seeking out excellence in people, process and self !
metadata: 带领MBA学生完成学术研究的关键阶段，以提高他们对全球战略和战术商业规划的理解。帮助学生培养对未来商业需求的成功至关重要的领导能力，同时保持追求人、流程和自我卓越的热情！

text: Washington State occupies 98.5 million square feet of owned and leased real estate supporting over 156 agencies at annual occupancy costs exceeding $3.2 billion. Occupancy management lead for state elected officials, agencies, boards, commissions and educational institutions covering more than 1,100 leases. Initiated Lean Six Sigma strategic workflow aligning state goals and objectives with available resources. Led the development of CRE Information Systems to support strategic analysis and work processes. Enhanced customer satisfaction, strengthened tactical execution through Lean Six Sigma and ROI opportunities. 2014 Washington State Governors Award for Leadership in Management nomination. Achieved $13.2 million in lease savings and cost avoidance from 2013 - 2015. Member of Washington State's Emergency Management Team. Implemented measurement metrics to quantify productivity. Negotiated $24.5 million warehouse disposition. Closed-out 260 lingering lease renewal projects in 12-months.
metadata: 华盛顿州拥有9850万平方英尺的自有和租赁房地产，支持156家机构，年入住成本超过32亿美元。国家民选官员、机构、董事会、委员会和教育机构的占用管理负责人，涉及1100多个租约。启动精益六西格玛战略工作流，使州目标与可用资源保持一致。领导CRE信息系统的开发，以支持战略分析和工作流程。通过精益六西格玛和ROI机会提高客户满意度，加强战术执行。2014年华盛顿州州长管理领导奖提名。从2013年到2015年，实现了1320万美元的租赁节约和成本规避。华盛顿州应急管理团队成员。实施衡量指标以量化生产力。商定了2450万美元的仓库处置。在12个月内完成了260个延期续租项目。

text: National Science Foundation I-CORPS Lean Business Start-Up Initiative. As I-CORPS mentor I serve as an extension of the NSF teaching team responsible for success or failure of teams. Devoted to assist core start-up teams testing various hypotheses throughout business modeling; bridging potential gaps between academia and business.
metadata: 美国国家科学基金会I-CORPS精益企业创业计划。作为I-CORPS导师，我是NSF教学团队的延伸，负责团队的成败。致力于协助核心初创团队在整个业务建模过程中测试各种假设；弥合学术界和商界之间的潜在差距。

text: Directed real estate portfolio and transaction management covering 15 million s/f Western U.S. portfolio for second largest bank holding company in U.S. Managed enterprise-wide teams in sale of major bank assets. Delivered positive impact to company bottom-line; occupancy cost savings ($4.5 million, 169% of goal), increase sublease revenues ($30 million, 101% of goal), improve occupancy efficiency (reduction of 524,000 s/f, 140% of goal for annual cost save of $23.6 million). Negotiated and closed hundreds of millions of dollars in sale leasebacks: $100 million for 1.2-million-square-foot office campus in Concord CA; $86 million for 1.1-million office tower in San Francisco, CA (68 days contract to close); and $14-million California parking facility. Managed US Western transition of real estate assets from Countrywide and Merrill Lynch to Bank of America.
metadata: 为美国第二大银行控股公司指导房地产投资组合和交易管理，涵盖1500万美元的美国西部s/f投资组合。管理销售主要银行资产的企业范围团队。对公司底线产生积极影响；入住成本节约（450万美元，目标的169%），增加转租收入（3000万美元，目标的101%），提高入住效率（减少524000平方英尺，目标的140%，年成本节约2360万美元）。谈判并完成了数亿美元的售后回租：加利福尼亚州康科德120万平方英尺办公园区的1亿美元$8600万美元，用于购买加利福尼亚州旧金山110万座办公楼（68天合同到期）；和1400万美元的加州停车设施。管理美国西部房地产资产从Countrywide和Merrill Lynch向美国银行的过渡。

text: 1) Collaborate with PAHO/WHO to advance the Policy on Research for Health (CD49/10) with activities such as consultations and development of policies, strategies, partnerships, and standards on emerging issues. 2) Interface with PAHO/WHO’s knowledge translation platforms to advance knowledge translation and integration of research evidence with policy, prevention and health care. Similarly, seek to link regional and global policies and agendas to relevant research proposals. 3) In collaboration with PAHO/WHO, contribute towards the assessment, monitoring and evaluation of research, as well as promotion and prevention programs, such as public health preparedness, health equality and literacy, and chronic NCDs associated with lifestyle as an essential public health function to build capacity and sustainability. 4) Become a model institution in implementing the Policy on Research for Health and, at PAHO/WHO’s request, jointly organize volunteer and internship programs.

text: The Digital City Testbed Center (DCTC) is one of PSU's two university research centers established in October 2018. DCTC is creating a network of academic, corporate and nonprofit campuses in the Cascadia region of Oregon, Washington and British Columbia where neighboring cities can test urban technological and policy innovation before these are deployed in neighborhoods and business districts. The first five campus testbeds are those of PSU, UBC, Portland International Airport, the Oregon Museum of Science and Industry, and the University of Washington. Areas of particular emphasis include accessibility for people with limited mobility, sight or hearing; public education about smart, resilient cities; ways technology can help make cities more resilient to climate change; and the use of digital technology to monitor the health of urban tree canopies.
metadata: 数字城市试验台中心（DCTC）是PSU于2018年10月成立的两个大学研究中心之一。DCTC正在俄勒冈州、华盛顿州和不列颠哥伦比亚省的卡斯卡迪亚地区建立一个学术、企业和非营利校园网络，在该网络中，周边城市可以测试城市技术和政策创新，然后再将其部署到社区和商业区。前五个校园试验场分别是PSU、UBC、波特兰国际机场、俄勒冈州科学与工业博物馆和华盛顿大学。特别强调的领域包括为行动、视力或听力有限的人提供无障碍环境；关于智慧、弹性城市的公共教育；技术如何帮助城市更具应对气候变化的能力；并利用数字技术监测城市树冠的健康状况。

text: Working in University of British Columbia's Research and Innovation office, I'm helping build research partnerships with academic institutions, corporations, government agencies, and nonprofits across British Columbia, Washington, and Oregon, as part of the Cascadia Innovation Corridor initiative. Focus areas include urban analytic/smart cities (https://www.cascadiadata.org/); wildfires (https://sites.google.com/pdx.edu/cascadiawildfireandurbansmoke/home); and accessibility for people with disabilities. I also hold a 4.5-year, half-time visiting professor position in UBC’s Department of Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences.
metadata: 我在不列颠哥伦比亚大学研究与创新办公室工作，作为卡斯卡迪亚创新走廊计划的一部分，我正在帮助不列颠哥伦比亚、华盛顿和俄勒冈州的学术机构、企业、政府机构和非营利组织建立研究伙伴关系。重点领域包括城市分析/智慧城市(https://www.cascadiadata.org/); 野火(https://sites.google.com/pdx.edu/cascadiawildfireandurbansmoke/home); 以及残疾人的无障碍环境。我还在UBC地球、海洋和大气科学系担任了4.5年半的客座教授。

text: ➤ Responsible for the cluster on global and emerging risks. The cluster is based on three pillars: ◆ Traditional geopolitical risks (warfare, conflicts, terrorism). ◆ Risks and resilience related to the impact of emerging technologies (especially artificial intelligence) on international security and society. ◆ The impact of geopolitical risks on the private sector. ➤ Teach various courses on: ◆ The impact of geopolitical risks on specific industries (banking, oil and gas, tourism...) ◆ Disruptive technologies and international security ◆ Middle East and Gulf security ◆ Transformation of war and conflicts ◆ Terrorism ◆ Energy security ◆ Risk and resilience related to accident and terrorist attacks involving weapons of mass destruction ➤ Conduct research on risks and emerging technologies: ◆ Risks related to the Fourth Industrial Revolution (especially artificial intelligence and neuroscience) ◆ Global geopolitical risks ◆ Middle East and Gulf security ➤ Liaise with the private sector and specific industries to raise awareness about the impact of geopolitical risks
metadata: ➤ 负责全球和新兴风险集群。该集群基于三大支柱：◆ 传统地缘政治风险（战争、冲突、恐怖主义）。◆ 与新兴技术（尤其是人工智能）对国际安全和社会的影响有关的风险和弹性。◆ 地缘政治风险对私营部门的影响。➤ 在以下方面教授各种课程：◆ 地缘政治风险对特定行业（银行业、石油天然气、旅游业等）的影响◆ 破坏性技术和国际安全◆ 中东和海湾安全◆ 战争和冲突的转变◆ 恐怖主义◆ 能源安全◆ 与涉及大规模毁灭性武器的事故和恐怖袭击有关的风险和恢复力➤ 开展风险和新兴技术研究：◆ 与第四次工业革命（尤其是人工智能和神经科学）相关的风险◆ 全球地缘政治风险◆ 中东和海湾安全➤ 与私营部门和特定行业联系，提高对地缘政治风险影响的认识

text: I collaborate with entrepreneurs and leading professionals to help them create content that is both engaging and highly valuable. This includes work on social media, content for books, newsletter issues and internal communications with employees. In all cases, my process revolves around the profound practice of taking time once a week to talk about what matters most to you.
metadata: 我与企业家和顶尖专业人士合作，帮助他们创建既吸引人又极具价值的内容。这包括社交媒体、书籍内容、时事通讯以及与员工的内部沟通。在所有情况下，我的过程都围绕着一个深刻的实践，即每周花一次时间谈论对你来说最重要的事情。

text: Ghostwriter and executive coach for a wide range of clients. During this period, I also developed and delivered training programs on a variety of topics, most notably including personalization, customer and employee relationships, and innovation.
metadata: 为众多客户提供代笔和执行教练。在此期间，我还制定并提供了各种主题的培训计划，其中最显著的包括个性化、客户和员工关系以及创新。

text: This was SO much fun. I was one of the four original partners of this highly regarded one-to-one strategy consultancy, launched in the earliest days of the Web. Our ideas helped countless companies learn to better serve their customers. I started and led our Training and Research divisions, and also launched our 1to1 newsletter, which served as a major source of revenue for the company. We helped our partner firms Epiphany, Broadvision, and Pivotal grow from startups to public companies, by accelerating adoption of their offerings. In one of my toughest and most satisfying challenges, Don Peppers and I helped HP launch over 100 initiatives to grow share of customer. ► Delivered over 100 paid speeches and workshops. ► Created many of the frameworks that drove the firm's Consulting practice.
metadata: 这太有趣了。我是这家备受推崇的一对一战略咨询公司的四位原始合作伙伴之一，该公司成立于互联网的早期。我们的想法帮助无数公司学会更好地为客户服务。我创办并领导了我们的培训和研究部门，还推出了我们的1对1新闻稿，这是公司的主要收入来源。我们帮助我们的合作公司Epiphany、Broadvision和Pivotal从初创公司成长为上市公司，加快了其产品的采用。我和唐·佩珀斯（DonPeppers）帮助惠普推出了100多项计划，以扩大客户份额，这是我面临的最严峻、最令人满意的挑战之一。► 发表了100多场有偿演讲和研讨会。► 创建了许多推动公司咨询实践的框架。

text: Need a lesson in wordsmithing? Work here, when the culture still revolved around David Ogilvy's genius. I was lucky enough to work on the IBM account, first by running the direct marketing account for IBM PC Company, and then serving as interactive strategist for the broader IBM account. Said another way, in my small way, I helped IBM figure out the Web.
metadata: 需要上一堂文字制作课吗？在这里工作，那时文化仍然围绕着大卫·奥格尔维的天才。我很幸运地在IBM客户上工作，首先是为IBM PC公司运营直销客户，然后担任更广泛的IBM客户的互动策略师。换句话说，我用自己的小方法帮助IBM解决了网络问题。

text: I'd never been in a factory in my life, when my boss quit and the company told me to turn his idea for $90 "precision-engineered die-cast model cars" into a real business. There was just one problem: we could sell them, but not make them. In three years, I went to Asia 14 times to fire one factory and then start two new ones. In between trips, I accelerated our marketing efforts and brought tens of thousands of new customers to the company. I generated $20 million in sales and established a profitable product line that roared along for 25 years.
metadata: 我这辈子从来没有进过工厂，当时我的老板辞职了，公司让我把他90美元的“精密工程压铸模型汽车”的想法变成一个真正的生意。只有一个问题：我们可以销售，但不能生产。三年内，我去了亚洲14次，解雇了一家工厂，然后又开了两家新工厂。在两次旅行之间，我加快了我们的营销工作，为公司带来了成千上万的新客户。我创造了2000万美元的销售额，并建立了一条盈利的产品线，持续了25年。

text: Charter member of this highly-regarded, highly-impactful, and very forward-looking think tank. On the Twentieth Anniversary of the Agile Manifesto, we collectively crafted "The Future Fit Manifesto" - a manifesto that charges organizations with proactively shaping their futures, not simply reacting to the future as it unfolds - a recipe that no longer works given the pace of technological change we are witnessing. This think tank will constantly champion the cause of the Future Fit / Future Ready organization - organizations capable of remaining relevant to the world of today, while also resilient to the ongoing sea of change happening all about us. These are the organizations who will still be creating tremendous value - not years, not decades, but centuries from now.
metadata: 这家备受推崇、极具影响力和前瞻性的智库的特许成员。在《敏捷宣言》发表二十周年之际，我们共同制定了“未来适应宣言”（Future Fit Manifesto）——该宣言要求各组织积极塑造自己的未来，而不仅仅是对未来的发展做出反应——鉴于我们所见证的技术变革的速度，这一配方不再有效。该智囊团将持续支持“适应未来/为未来做好准备的组织”的事业，即能够与当今世界保持关联的组织，同时也能够应对我们周围正在发生的巨大变化。这些组织仍将创造巨大的价值——不是几年，不是几十年，而是几个世纪以后。

text: Gijs van Wulfen is a recognised authority and keynote speaker on innovation and Design Thinking. He is an illustrative lyrical storyteller with an articulate informal style, which is full of humor, entertainment and insight. He has been keynoting for companies like NEC (Japan), 3M (USA), AIRBUS Group (France), ENZEN (India) and BIlfinger (Netherlands). He's a regular speaker at big innovation conferences like 'The South African Innovation Summit, 'The Turkish Innovation Week', 'The Polish Innovation Day' and 'The 3rd Innovation Forum' in Porto Alegre (Brazil). Movies and reviews of his performances you find at gijsvanwulfen.com
metadata: Gijs van Wulfen是公认的创新和设计思维权威和主旨发言人。他是一个富有说明性的抒情故事讲述者，具有清晰的非正式风格，充满幽默、娱乐和洞察力。他曾为NEC（日本）、3M（美国）、空客集团（法国）、ENZEN（印度）和BIlfinger（荷兰）等公司担任重要职务。他是在阿雷格里港（巴西）“南非创新峰会”、“土耳其创新周”、“波兰创新日”和“第三届创新论坛”等大型创新会议上的定期发言人。你可以在gijsvanwulfen找到他的电影和表演评论。通用域名格式

text: Gijs is the founder of the FORTH innovation method and help organisations to jump start innovation by facilitating this effective method. It helps them creating a culture for innovation. His clients are both companies in industry and services and non profit organisations looking for innovative products, - services, business models or new markets. His focus is on new product development, new service development, innovation strategy and innovation management. He works all over the globe.

text: Rachel Marsden Global Corporation* is an international, independent political and business intelligence firm with extensive experience in Defense, Intelligence, Security/Cybersecurity, Politics, Media and Public Affairs issues. Using OSINT, HUMINT/CY-HUMINT, FININT, the consultancy’s mission is to assist companies in analyzing, identifying, and capitalizing on the opportunities presented through globalization, and to mitigate associated risks. Services include: Independent research and reporting on regulatory, market, and competitive matters. Transactional and operational due diligence. Multijurisdictional political or business intelligence investigations. Communications, media relations/training and production, and public affairs services. NDA clients (including Fortune 100 companies) span multiple sectors and jurisdictions. Services: www.rachelmarsdenglobal.com *Registered Canadian corporation with foreign subsidiaries.
metadata: Rachel Marsden Global Corporation*是一家国际性、独立的政治和商业情报公司，在国防、情报、安全/网络安全、政治、媒体和公共事务方面拥有丰富的经验。利用OSINT、HUMINT/CY-HUMINT、FININT，咨询公司的使命是帮助公司分析、识别和利用全球化带来的机遇，并缓解相关风险。服务包括：独立研究和报告监管、市场和竞争事项。交易和运营尽职调查。多司法管辖区政治或商业情报调查。通信、媒体关系/培训和制作以及公共事务服务。NDA客户（包括财富100强公司）跨越多个部门和司法管辖区。服务：www.rachelmarsdenglobal。com*注册加拿大公司，拥有外国子公司。

text: ICON is a NGO (Non Gouvernemental Organisation) that federates a International community working on trust in cyberspace. The common objective is to bring about a conscious reaction through vulgarization and decodage of the information society for the civil society. ICON carries out concrete actions and exploration for future generations in the field of new technologies with a focus on cybersecurity, artificial intelligence and blockchain. -> Understanding cyberspace today and tomorrow -> Raise citizens’ awareness of technical and societal issues -> Promote innovation, research and development in digital trust with a focus on cybersecurity and AI -> Strengthening dialogue between citizens, defence companies and institutions Axiom : Bring trust and humanize the digital world The journey to digital trust #HACKER4GOOD
metadata: ICON是一个非政府组织（非政府组织），联合致力于网络空间信任的国际社会。共同的目标是通过对信息社会的庸俗化和修饰，为民间社会带来有意识的反应。ICON在新技术领域为子孙后代开展具体行动和探索，重点关注网络安全、人工智能和区块链。->了解今天和明天的网络空间->提高公民对技术和社会问题的认识->促进数字信任的创新、研究和发展，重点关注网络安全和AI->加强公民、国防公司和机构之间的对话公理：带来信任并使数字世界人性化走向数字信任之旅#黑客4好

text: Tech4Trust is the first Swiss startup acceleration program in the field of Digital Trust and Cybersecurity. Building and maintaining trust is a major challenge for tomorrow’s society and economy. Good news is innovative solutions do exist. metadata: Tech4Trust是瑞士在数字信任和网络安全领域的第一个创业加速计划。建立和维护信任是未来社会和经济面临的重大挑战。好消息是，确实存在创新的解决方案。Tech4Trust计划为期6个月，旨在推动初创公司开发创新解决方案，以应对信任的重大挑战，并确保参与者与解决信任问题的组织保持联系。链接：https://trustvalley.swiss/tech4trust/

text: Following a feasibility study conducted by Rand Corporation Europe, the European Commission decided to establish a European Cybercrime Centre (EC3) at Europol. The Centre will be the focal point in the EU’s fight against cybercrime, contributing to faster reactions in the event of online crimes. It will support Member States and the European Union’s institutions in building operational and analytical capacity for investigations and cooperation with international partners. EC3 officially commenced its activities on 1 January 2013 with a mandate to tackle the following areas of cybercrime: That committed by organised groups to generate large criminal profits such as online fraud That which causes serious harm to the victim such as online child sexual exploitation That which affects critical infrastructure and information systems in the European Union EC3 aims to become the focal point in the EU’s fight against cybercrime, through building operational and analytical capacity for investigations and cooperation with international partners in the pursuit of an EU free from cybercrime. The European Cybercrime Centre is hosted by Europol; the European law enforcement agency in The Hague, The Netherlands, and thus EC3 can draw on Europol’s existing infrastructure and law enforcement network.
metadata: 在兰德欧洲公司进行可行性研究后，欧盟委员会决定在欧洲刑警组织设立一个欧洲网络犯罪中心（EC3）。该中心将成为欧盟打击网络犯罪的协调中心，有助于在发生网络犯罪时作出更快的反应。它将支持成员国和欧洲联盟各机构建设调查和与国际伙伴合作的业务和分析能力。EC3于2013年1月1日正式开始活动，其任务是解决以下网络犯罪领域：有组织团体为获取巨额犯罪利润而实施的犯罪，如对受害者造成严重伤害的在线欺诈，如影响欧盟关键基础设施和信息系统的在线儿童性剥削，EC3旨在在欧盟打击网络犯罪的斗争中，通过建立业务和分析能力进行调查，并与国际伙伴合作，以建立一个没有网络犯罪的欧盟，成为欧盟打击网络犯罪的协调中心。欧洲网络犯罪中心由欧洲刑警组织主办；设在荷兰海牙的欧洲执法机构以及欧洲刑警组织EC3可以利用欧洲刑警组织现有的基础设施和执法网络。

Having driven large-scale change from both the client and client-service side, I help CXO's shape their strategic direction, build their teams' capabilities, and become more digitally agile. My advisory work has included: Pointillist (Customer Journey Analytics); SundaySky (Personalized Video); Videa Health (AI-driven Dental Radiology); Grazitti (Offshore tech outsourcing); OfferFit (AI-driven Marketing content optimization), and others

text: The Swiss Military Review (RMS) celebrated in 2006 its 150th year of uninterrupted publication. It is the 2nd oldest military/strategic publication in Europe. RMS is the official francophone publication of the Swiss Officer Society (SOG/SSO). It is owned by the cantonal societies of the French speaking cantons. RMS is a bi-monthly publication and comes out 8 times a year, including 2 thematic issues. RMS focuses on security, defence, strategic and policy issues. It is a significant contribution to the field of International relations, History and Geopolitics.
metadata: 2006年，《瑞士军事评论》（RMS）庆祝了其连续出版150周年。这是欧洲第二古老的军事/战略出版物。RMS是瑞士军官协会（SOG/SSO）的法语官方出版物。它由法语州的州协会所有。《RMS》是一本双月刊，每年出版8次，包括2期专题。RMS专注于安全、国防、战略和政策问题。这是对国际关系、历史和地缘政治领域的重大贡献。

text: The Leadership in Post-Conflict Management Programme focuses on three areas: critical and informed policy review and decision-making, collaborative leadership, and intercultural understanding in relation to conflict management/environments. The Programme seeks to enhance the ability of practitioners, policy actors and institutions to arrive at informed policy development and decision-making on key contemporary international developments, critical issues and challenges, and contribute constructively to the policy debate in areas of peace and security. The Programme targets individuals and institutions in government, military, private sector and civil society that play an active, key role in the development of policy and resolution of conflict.
metadata: 冲突后管理领导方案侧重于三个领域：关键和知情的政策审查和决策、协作领导以及与冲突管理/环境有关的文化间理解。该方案力求提高从业人员、政策行动者和机构的能力，以便就当代主要国际事态发展、关键问题和挑战达成知情的政策制定和决策，并为和平与安全领域的政策辩论作出建设性贡献。该方案针对在制定政策和解决冲突方面发挥积极关键作用的政府、军事、私营部门和民间社会的个人和机构。

text: Associate Professor (2006-2015) and Head of the International Relations Department (2006-2013). Visiting Professor in Beijing, PRC and Accra, Ghana. Webster University is a private American university, founded in 1911 and accredited since 1915. It is present on over 100 campuses accross the world, including 4 in Europe: Geneva (CH), Vienna (AT), London (GB) and Leiden (NL). The Geneva campus is host to approximately 600 students from over 90 countries, studying Business, Management, International Relations (IR), Media & Communication, Councelling and Human Resources. The IR department consisted of 22 faculty and approximately 150 undergraduate and 30 graduate students. IR degrees included a BA in International Relations (with emphasis in Economics, Migration, History or Comparative Politics), as well as an executive MA program. An MA in International Non Governmental Organizations (INGO) was also established during my tenure. Webster is reputed for its emphasis in Humanitarian issues, including a yearly international conference held in the spring at CICG, Geneva, with the longstanding participation and support of ICRC and UNHCR, as well as Geneva's Conseil d'Etat.
metadata: 副教授（2006-2015年）兼国际关系系主任（2006-2013年）。中国北京和加纳阿克拉客座教授。韦伯斯特大学是一所私立美国大学，成立于1911年，自1915年起获得认证。它在全球100多个校区设有分校，其中包括4个欧洲校区：日内瓦（CH）、维也纳（AT）、伦敦（GB）和莱顿（NL）。日内瓦校区有来自90多个国家的约600名学生，学习商业、管理、国际关系、媒体与传播、咨询和人力资源。IR系由22名教员、约150名本科生和30名研究生组成。IR学位包括国际关系学士学位（重点是经济学、移民、历史或比较政治），以及行政管理硕士课程。在我任职期间，还设立了国际非政府组织文学硕士学位。韦伯斯特以强调人道主义问题而闻名，包括春季在日内瓦CICG举行的年度国际会议，红十字委员会和联合国难民事务高级专员办事处以及日内瓦委员会的长期参与和支持。

text: Over the past three decades author, advisor, and keynote speaker Daniel Burrus has established a worldwide reputation for accurately predicting the future of technological change and its impact on the world of business. He has helped hundreds of clients identify game-changing opportunities and develop successful competitive business strategies based on his Hard Trend methodology and Anticipatory Organization Model. As an innovative and impactful keynote speaker, Daniel is a master story teller blending timely and provocative knowledge and actionable insights with just the right amount of humor and motivation audiences can take away and use immediately to accelerate innovation and results. Daniel is a global futurist and disruptive innovation expert who empowers his audiences by teaching them how to find certainty in a seemingly uncertain world He offers powerful guidance and examples to help audiences: -Separate Hard Trends that will happen from Soft Trends that might happen. -Use the certainty of Hard Trends to have the confidence to make bold moves. -Use Hard Trends to elevate planning, accelerate innovation and transform results. -Empower audiences with a proven methodology to take positive action. -Learn which current and emerging technologies will have the biggest impact on different industries. -Learn how to creatively apply technology Hard Trends to create strategic value and competitive advantage. -Learn powerful personal strategies for actively shaping your future. Daniel Burrus’ Accolades -The New York Times named Daniel as one of the top three gurus in the highest demand as a speaker. -He has been voted by his peers and clients as one of the Top Five Futurists and Technology Speakers every year since the award program started. -Has been inducted into the Professional Speakers Hall of Fame. -He has delivered over 3,000 keynote speeches on six continents to audiences from 25 to 14,000.
metadata: 在过去的三十年中，作者、顾问兼主讲人丹尼尔·伯鲁斯（DanielBurrus）因准确预测技术变革的未来及其对商业世界的影响而享誉全球。他已经帮助数百名客户发现了改变游戏规则的机会，并根据他的硬趋势方法和预期组织模式制定了成功的竞争性商业战略。作为一位富有创新精神和影响力的主讲人，Daniel是一位讲故事的大师，他将及时而富有挑衅性的知识和可操作的见解与观众可以立即获得并使用的幽默和动机融为一体，以加速创新和成果。Daniel是一位全球未来主义和颠覆性创新专家，他通过教观众如何在看似不确定的世界中找到确定性来增强他们的能力。他提供了强大的指导和例子来帮助观众：-区分将要发生的硬趋势和可能发生的软趋势-利用硬趋势的确定性，有信心采取大胆的行动-利用硬趋势提升规划、加速创新并改变结果-用行之有效的方法让受众采取积极行动-了解哪些当前和新兴技术将对不同行业产生最大影响-了解如何创造性地应用技术硬趋势来创造战略价值和竞争优势-学习积极塑造未来的强大个人策略。DanielBurrus的荣誉——《纽约时报》将Daniel评为演讲者需求量最大的前三位大师之一-自该奖项开始以来，他每年都被同行和客户评选为前五名未来主义者和技术演说家之一-已入选职业演讲者名人堂-他在六大洲向25至14000名观众发表了3000多场主题演讲。

text: Burrus Research is a research and consulting firm that monitors global advancements in science and technology-driven trends to help clients better understand how technological, social and business forces are converging to create enormous, untapped opportunities. In 1983, founder and CEO Daniel Burrus became the first and only futurist to link the exponential growth of computing power to economic value creation and accurately identify the twenty technologies that would become the driving forces of business and economic change for decades to come. His 1983 Taxonomy of High Technology included Artificial Intelligence, Genetic Engineering, Supercomputers, Digital Electronics, Flat Panel Displays, Nanotechnology, Distributed Computing and the Internet to name a few. Over the past thirty eight years Burrus has used his methodology of separating Hard Trends based on future facts that will happen from Soft Trends based on assumptions that might happen to establish a worldwide reputation for his exceptional record of predicting the future of technological change and its direct impact on the business world. He has helped hundreds of clients, including many from the Fortune 500 accelerate innovation and results by using his methodologies to identify game-changing opportunities and develop successful competitive strategies based on the creative application of leading-edge technologies. Burrus has written seven books that have been translated into dozens of languages and he delivered over 3,000 keynote speeches to corporations, associations, and professional organizations worldwide. His interest in research became apparent in his third year of college, when Burrus became one of the first undergraduates in the United States to direct a federal research grant. He has founded and managed six businesses, four of which were leaders in the U.S. in their first year. As a highly successful entrepreneur, he knows how to translate research findings into practical business advantages.
metadata: Burrus Research是一家研究和咨询公司，负责监控全球科技驱动趋势的进展，帮助客户更好地了解技术、社会和商业力量如何汇聚在一起，创造巨大的、未开发的机会。1983年，创始人兼首席执行官丹尼尔·伯鲁斯（DanielBurrus）成为第一位也是唯一一位将计算能力的指数增长与经济价值创造联系起来的未来主义者，并准确确定了未来几十年将成为商业和经济变革驱动力的二十种技术。1983年，他对高科技的分类包括人工智能、基因工程、超级计算机、数字电子、平板显示器、纳米技术、分布式计算和互联网等。在过去的三十八年中，Burrus使用了他的方法，将基于未来事实的硬趋势与基于假设的软趋势相分离，这些假设可能会碰巧建立起全球声誉，因为他在预测技术变革的未来及其对商业世界的直接影响方面有着卓越的记录。他帮助数百名客户，包括许多财富500强的客户，通过使用他的方法来识别改变游戏规则的机会，并基于前沿技术的创造性应用制定成功的竞争战略，从而加速创新和成果。Burrus写了七本书，已被翻译成几十种语言，并向全世界的公司、协会和专业组织发表了3000多场主题演讲。他对研究的兴趣在大学三年级时变得很明显，当时Burrus成为美国第一批获得联邦研究资助的本科生之一。他创办并管理了六家企业，其中四家在第一年就成为了美国的领导者。作为一名非常成功的企业家，他知道如何将研究成果转化为实际的商业优势。

text: Daniel Burrus is the author of seven books, including The New York Times and Wall Street Journal best-seller Flash Foresight: How To See The Invisible and Do The Impossible, and his latest book, The Anticipatory Organization: How To Turn Disruption and Change Into Opportunity and Advantage is a number one Amazon best seller. He has delivered over 3,000 keynote speeches, and he is a strategic advisor to executives from Fortune 500 firms helping them to develop game-changing strategies based on his Hard Trend methodologies for capitalizing on technology innovations and their future impact. His client list includes Lockheed Martin, Verizon, Microsoft, VISA, Deloitte, KPMG, FedEx, and the U.S. Department of Defense. He's a featured writer on the topics of disruptive innovation, change and the future for publications including the Harvard Business Review, Huffington Post, and Wired Magazine to name a few. He has been the featured subject of several PBS television specials and has appeared on programs such as CNN, CNBC, Fox Business, and Bloomberg, and is quoted in a variety of publications, including The Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, Fortune, and Forbes. He has founded six businesses, three of which were national leaders in the United States in the first year. He is the CEO of Burrus Research, a research and consulting firm that monitors global advancements in technology driven trends to help clients profit from technological, social and business forces that are converging to create enormous, untapped opportunities. His accurate predictions date back to the early 1980s where he became the first and only futurist to accurately identify the twenty technologies that would become the driving force of business and economic change for decades to come. Since then, he has continued to establish a worldwide reputation for his exceptional record of predicting the future of technology driven change and its direct impact on the business world.
metadata: 丹尼尔·伯鲁斯（DanielBurrus）著有七本书，包括《纽约时报》和《华尔街日报》（Wall Street Journal）畅销书《Flash Foresight：如何看不见的东西，如何做不可能的事情》，他的最新著作《预期组织：如何将颠覆和变革转化为机遇和优势》（the Preventive Organization:How To Turning Distribution and Change To Opportunity and Advantage）是亚马逊。他发表了3000多篇主题演讲，是《财富》500强企业高管的战略顾问，帮助他们根据其硬趋势方法制定改变游戏规则的战略，以利用技术创新及其未来影响。他的客户名单包括洛克希德·马丁、Verizon、微软、VISA、德勤、毕马威、联邦快递和美国国防部。他是《哈佛商业评论》（Harvard Business Review）、《赫芬顿邮报》（Huffington Post）和《连线杂志》（Wired Magazine）等出版物的颠覆性创新、变革和未来主题的特邀作家。他是美国公共广播公司（PBS）多个电视特辑的主题人物，曾出现在美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）、美国全国广播公司（CNBC）、福克斯商业（Fox Business）和彭博社（Bloomberg）等节目中，并被《华尔街日报》、《金融时报》、《财富》（Fortune）和《福布斯》（Forbes）等多家出版物引用。他创办了六家企业，其中三家在第一年是美国的国家领导人。他是Burrus Research的首席执行官。Burrus Research是一家研究和咨询公司，负责监测全球技术驱动趋势的进展，帮助客户从技术、社会和商业力量中获利，这些力量正汇聚在一起，创造巨大的、未开发的机会。他准确的预测可以追溯到20世纪80年代初，当时他是第一位也是唯一一位准确识别二十种技术的未来主义者，这二十种技术将成为未来几十年商业和经济变革的驱动力。自那以后，他一直以其预测技术驱动变革的未来及其对商业世界的直接影响的卓越记录而在世界范围内建立声誉。

text: This list is comprised of retail experts, consultants, analysts, academics, journalists, and thought leaders who are making an impact in retail in 2022. Influencers are recognized for their activity within the online retail community. Influencers frequently comment on retail trends or news stories, share industry insights and join thought leadership discussions. These influencers take on many roles. We selected executives from academia, media, consultancies and analyst firms.
metadata: 这份名单由零售业专家、顾问、分析师、学者、记者和思想领袖组成，他们将在2022年对零售业产生影响。影响者因其在在线零售社区中的活动而受到认可。影响者经常对零售趋势或新闻故事发表评论，分享行业见解，并加入思想领导力讨论。这些影响者扮演着许多角色。我们从学术界、媒体、咨询公司和分析公司中挑选高管。

text: HPU’s National Board of Advisors is comprised of Fortune 500 CEOs, thought leaders, and distinguished visionaries who have positively impacted the United States and the world in significant ways. Burrus joins distinguished members of the board such as Gen. Colin Powell, former secretary of state, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and national security advisor; Steve Wozniak, Apple co-founder; and Dr. Tony Atala, director of the Wake Forest Institute for Regenerative Medicine.
metadata: HPU的国家顾问委员会由财富500强的首席执行官、思想领袖和杰出的远见者组成，他们在很大程度上对美国和世界产生了积极影响。Burrus加入了杰出的董事会成员，如前国务卿、参谋长联席会议主席、国家安全顾问科林·鲍威尔将军；苹果联合创始人史蒂夫·沃兹尼亚克；以及维克森林再生医学研究所所长托尼·阿塔拉博士。

text: Visionary Apps was founded in 2009 by leading Technology Forecaster and Business Strategist Daniel Burrus, and in 2012 the companies IP was turned into a licensing organization working under his other firm, Burrus Research, We were the first to develop and release national mobile real estate apps in the U.S. including Complete Foreclosures covering all U.S. foreclosures, Complete Rentals covering all U.S. rentals, and Complete Homes listing all U.S. homes for sale. We released the Complete Realty Suite, first for the iPhone and iPod Touch, and then followed by the iPad and Android versions. We became the 17th most downloaded app in the first week. All leading the revolution in the way that people conduct their home buying searches, and the way realtors connect with and assist potential homebuyers. We are proud to report that today's home buying mobile apps use the same underlying design we pioneered. We were also the first to have International real estate mobile apps. In addition, we were the first to develop a mobile app for the military focusing on emergency response. Visionary Apps seeks to utilize the constantly evolving Smart Phone, Smart Tablet and Smart TV to bring never before seen opportunities designed to engage and empower the user in new and exciting ways in a wide range of fields including real estate, healthcare, purchasing, logistics, supply chain, sales, marketing, energy, security and many more. In January, 2012 the company IP was moved to a licensing organization. Burrus Research has taken over developing comprehensive mobility strategies for organizations worldwide helping clients take advantage of the rapid revolution in smart technology. For more information about Visionary Apps, visit our website at: http://www.visionaryapps.com
metadata: Visionary Apps于2009年由领先的技术预测师和商业策略师Daniel Burrus创建，2012年，公司IP转变为一个许可组织，隶属于他的另一家公司Burrus Research，我们是美国第一家开发和发布全国移动房地产应用程序的公司，包括涵盖所有美国止赎的完整止赎，完整租赁涵盖所有美国租赁，完整房屋列出所有美国待售房屋。我们发布了完整的房地产套件，首先是iPhone和iPod Touch，然后是iPad和Android版本。在第一周，我们成为下载量排名第17的应用程序。所有这些都在人们进行购房搜索的方式以及房地产经纪人联系和帮助潜在购房者的方式上引领了这场革命。我们很自豪地报告，今天的购房手机应用程序使用了我们开创的相同的底层设计。我们也是第一个拥有国际房地产移动应用程序的公司。此外，我们是第一个为军队开发一款专注于应急响应的移动应用程序。Visionary Apps寻求利用不断发展的智能手机、智能平板电脑和智能电视带来前所未有的机会，旨在在房地产、医疗保健、采购、物流、供应链、销售、营销、能源、安全等广泛领域以新的、令人兴奋的方式吸引和授权用户。2012年1月，公司知识产权转移至许可组织。Burrus Research已接手为全球组织制定全面的移动战略，帮助客户利用智能技术的快速革命。有关Visionary应用程序的更多信息，请访问我们的网站：http://www.visionaryapps.com

text: The Ada Lovelace Institute is an independent research and deliberative body with a mission to ensure data and AI work for people and society.

text: Soubrier’s research focuses on the security strategies and foreign policies of the countries of the Gulf Cooperation Council, particularly the United Arab Emirates, Qatar, and Saudi Arabia. She is specifically interested in analyzing the evolving trends of arms trade in the Gulf. Her research at AGSIW will examine the interrelations between arms trade and shifting dynamics in the political economy of Gulf Arab countries, as well as their international relations with powers outside the region.
metadata: 苏布里尔的研究重点是海湾合作委员会国家的安全战略和外交政策，特别是阿拉伯联合酋长国、卡塔尔和沙特阿拉伯。她对分析海湾武器贸易的发展趋势特别感兴趣。她在AGSIW的研究将考察武器贸易与海湾阿拉伯国家政治经济动态变化之间的相互关系，以及它们与该地区以外大国的国际关系。

text: Postdoctoral research on “The Reshaping of Gulf Security along the Lines of Princes-States Defense Strategies” (both affiliated as Postdoc Researcher at Auvergne University and as Visiting Scholar at George Washington University)
